latmiadeus: <entryFree id="n26012" type="main" key="Latmi^a^de_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Latmĭădēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. Latmus, II. B.</entryFree>
latmius: <entryFree id="n26013" type="main" key="Latmi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Latmĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Latmus, II.</entryFree>
latmus: <entryFree id="n26014" type="main" key="Latmus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Latmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*la/tmos</foreign>, <sense id="n26014.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain in Caria, at the mouth of the Mæander, where Luna (Selene) kissed the sleeping Endymion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:38:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 38, 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:17" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 113</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26014.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n26014.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Latmĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Mount Latmus, Latmian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latmius Endymion,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venator,</quote> <trans><tr>Endymion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:28" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26014.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Latmĭădēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same; of <hi rend="ital">Endymion</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 919</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lato: <entryFree id="n26015" type="main" key="La_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lāto</orth>, v. Latona.</entryFree>
latobius: <entryFree id="n26016" type="gloss" key="Latobius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Latobius</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26016.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an almost unknown deity</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2019</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
latobrigi: <entryFree id="n26017" type="main" key="Latobrigi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Latobrigi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26017.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Gallic people, neighbors of the Helvetians, situated probably on the Rhine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 28</bibl> sq.</sense></entryFree>
latoides: <entryFree id="n26018" type="main" key="La_to^i^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lātŏĭdes, Lātōis</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Lātōĭus</orth>, v. Latona.</entryFree>
latomiae: <entryFree id="n26019" type="main" key="la_to^mi^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lātŏmĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, v. lautumiae.</entryFree>
latomus: <entryFree id="n26020" type="main" key="la_to^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lātŏmus</orth>, v. lautumus.</entryFree>
latona: <entryFree id="n26021" type="main" key="La_to_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lātōna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (old <sense id="n26021.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi> Latonas, Liv. Andron. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 679</bibl> P.; Gr. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lāto</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:Sat. Mon. 83:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> Sat. Mon. 83, 1</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lhtw/</foreign>; Dor. <foreign lang="greek">*latw/</foreign>; Aeol. <foreign lang="greek">*la/twn</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">daughter of the Titan Cœus and Phœbe, and mother of Apollo and Diana, whom she brought forth on the floating island of Delos</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 16</bibl> Müll. (Trag. v. 424 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:18:section=48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 18, § 48</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:502" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 502</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:176" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 176</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:336" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 336</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 14" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26021.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n26021.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lātōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Latona, Latonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Delos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Diana</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:557" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 11, 557</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Luna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:29" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cynthus,</quote> <trans><tr>the mountain, on Delos, where Latona brought forth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:701" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 701</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lātōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Diana</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:34:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 34, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:405" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 405</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 534</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:696" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 696</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 393</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:679" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 679</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n26021.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lātōnĭgĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>Latona-gigno</etym>, <hi rend="ital">one born of Latona</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Latonigenae duo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Apollo and Diana</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agm. 320" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agm. 320</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26021.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lātōïus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Lētōïus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 15</bibl>, where others read <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lātōnĭa</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Latona, Latonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stirps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:2:3" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:1:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 15</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lātōïus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Apollo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 197</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26021.5" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lātōus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Latona</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 274</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lātōus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Apollo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:384" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 384</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:31:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 31, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26021.6" n="E" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lātŏĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*latwi+/dhs</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the son of Latona</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Apollo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latoiden canamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:695" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 695</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lātŏĭdae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the children of Latona</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Apollo and Diana; gen. plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latoidum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epit. 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26021.7" n="F" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lātōĭs</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Lētōis</orth>), <itype>ĭdis or ĭdos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*latwi+/s</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">*lhtwi+/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Latona, Latonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Calaurea,</quote> <trans><tr>sacred to Latona</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:384" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 384</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst. adj.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lātōis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis or ĭdos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Diana</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">timeo saevae Latoidos iram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:21:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 21, 153</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 278</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lator: <entryFree id="n26022" type="main" key="la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>latum, v. fero</etym>, <sense id="n26022.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bearer</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a mover</hi> or <hi rend="ital">proposer</hi> of a law (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">lator legis Semproniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:38:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 38, 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:2:4" default="NO">3, 2, 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">legis ambitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 9</bibl></cit>: latorum audacia, <hi rend="ital">of the proposers of laws</hi>, *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
latous: <entryFree id="n26023" type="main" key="La_to_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lātōus</orth>, v. Latona, II. D.</entryFree>
latovici: <entryFree id="n26024" type="main" key="Latovi^ci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Latovĭci</orth>, <itype>orum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26024.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in Pannonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 25, 28, § 148</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
latrabilis: <entryFree id="n26025" type="main" key="la_tra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lātrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. latro</etym>, <sense id="n26025.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">barking</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:11:103" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 11, 103</bibl></cit>: animal, Mythogr. Lat. 3, 9, 3: bestia, Boëth. ap. Porphyr. 1, p. 52.</sense></entryFree>
latrator: <entryFree id="n26026" type="main" key="la_tra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lātrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26026.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a barker</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n26026.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">a dog</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Molossi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Anubis (who is represented with the head of a dog),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:698" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 698</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:690" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 690</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26026.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a bawler, brawler</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a viro bono in rabulam latratoremque converti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 9, 12</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1041" /> <cb n="LATR" /></sense></entryFree>
latratorius: <entryFree id="n26027" type="main" key="la_tra_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lātrātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>latrator</etym>, <sense id="n26027.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">brawling, noisy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 23, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
latratus: <entryFree id="n26028" type="main" key="la_tra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lātrātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. latro</etym>, <sense id="n26028.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a barking</hi> (not ante-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 40, 61, § 142</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">apros Latratu turbabis agens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:411" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 411</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">venator cursu canis et latratibus instat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:751" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 751</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latratus edere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:450" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 450</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latratibus rumpuntur somni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:415" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 415</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasti canis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:12:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 12, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
latria: <entryFree id="n26029" type="main" key="latri_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">latrīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">latreia</foreign>, <sense id="n26029.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">service, worship</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> de Amic. 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
latrina: <entryFree id="n26030" type="main" key="la_tri_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lātrīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (collat. forms <orth extent="full" lang="la">lăvātrīna</orth>, <gen>f.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">lātrīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, Lucil. and Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 212, 10 sq.</bibl>; cf. Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2, p. 393" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, p. 393</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contr. from lavatrina, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=118" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 118</bibl> Müll.; 9, § 68 ib.</etym>. <sense id="n26030.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A bath</hi>: qui in latrina languet, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 212, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26030.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A water-closet, privy</hi>, Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 212, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 4, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:58" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 58</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Col. poët. 10, 85.—Form lavatrina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=118" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 118</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n26030.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A brothel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">latrinarum antistes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
latrinum: <entryFree id="n26031" type="main" key="la_tri_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lātrīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. latrina <sense id="n26031.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
latris: <entryFree id="n26032" type="main" key="La_tris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lātris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">la/tris</foreign>, a maid-servant, handmaid</etym>, <sense id="n26032.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female proper name</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deliciaeque meae Latris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 7, 75.</sense></entryFree>
latro: <entryFree id="n26033" type="main" key="la_tro1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lātro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n26033.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">loidore/w</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">latra/zein</foreign> = <foreign lang="greek">barbari/zein</foreign>, Hesych.], <hi rend="ital">to bark</hi> (cf. baubor). </sense><sense id="n26033.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si canes latrent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:20:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 20, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1066" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1066</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne latret canis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 128</bibl></cit>: quasi feta canes sine dentibus latrat, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=32" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 32</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 518 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">canis timidus vehementius latrat quam mordet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:4:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canino rictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:272" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 272</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scit cui latretur cum solus obambulet ipse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:459" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 459</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26033.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> for allatrare, <hi rend="ital">to bark at, bay</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senem adulterum Latrent Suburanae canes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:57" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervinam pellem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:551" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 551</bibl></cit>.—Also in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">latrari a canibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 10, 78, § 126</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26033.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Part. pres.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lātrans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a barker</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a dog</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">inmeriti fatum latrantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:412" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 412</bibl></cit>; <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:344" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 344</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26033.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26033.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To resound, roar</hi>, of water (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">latrantes undae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:396" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 396</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(amnis) Alpibus ortus fertur latrantibus undis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:470" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 470</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:1:451" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 1, 451</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n26033.6" n="2" level="3"> In speaking, <hi rend="ital">to rant, roar, bluster</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">latrant jam quidam oratores, non loquuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:15:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 15, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumperis et latras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 136</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26033.7" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to bark at</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis Obprobriis dignum latraverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 85</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26033.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to bark at, rage</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n26033.9" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">multa ab animalium vocibus tralata in homines, partim quae sunt aperta, partim obscura. Perspicua, ut Ennii: Animus cum pectore latrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=103" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 103</bibl></cit> Müll. (cf. Ann. v. 570 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">admoto latrant praecordia tactu,</quote> <trans><tr>rage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:1:13" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curae latrantes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 119</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26033.10" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnas latrantia pectora curas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:338" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 338</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26033.11" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n26033.12" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To demand vehemently</hi>: latrare Ennius pro poscere posuit, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:121" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> 121</bibl> Müll.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Enn. l. l.: cum sale panis Latrantem stomachum bene leniet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil aliud sibi naturam latrare, nisi ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26033.13" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Opening the mouth wide, pronounced with a wide mouth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc scripsit Latine Plautus cum latranti nomine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26034" type="main" key="la_^tro2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lā^tro</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">la/tris</foreign>, root <foreign lang="greek">la-, lav-</foreign>, in <foreign lang="greek">la/w, lei/a</foreign>; cf. lucrum</etym>, <sense id="n26034.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hired servant, hireling, mercenary, satellite, bodyguard</hi>, etc. (only ante-class.): haec effatus ibi, latrones dicta facessunt, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 306, 23</bibl> (Ann. v. 60 Vahl.).—Of mercenary soldiers: <cit><quote lang="la">latrones, quos conduxi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam hic latro in Sparta fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latronem suam qui auro vitam venditat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 20</bibl></cit> Fleck.; cf.: fortunas suas coepere latrones Inter se memorare, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 134, 29</bibl> (Ann. v. 528 Vahl.); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7, p. 141" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, p. 141</bibl> Müll., and the passage from Paul. ex Fest. infra.—</sense><sense id="n26034.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26034.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A freebooter, highwayman, robber, bandit, irregular soldier, brigand</hi> (opp. justi hostes). <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:27:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 27, 10</bibl>: latrones eos antiqui dicebant, qui conducti militabant. <foreign lang="greek">a)po\ th=s latrei/as</foreign>. At nunc viarum obsessores dicuntur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=118" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 118</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes hi sunt, qui nobis, aut quibus nos publice bellum decrevimus: ceteri latrones aut praedones sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:118" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos latrones et mendicos homines magni penditis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2</bibl></cit>, <cb n="LATR" /> 75: <cit><quote lang="la">collecti ex praedonibus latronibusque Syriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 110</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 109</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 3, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat ei vivendum latronum ritu, ut tantum haberet, quantum rapere potuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:25:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 25, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non semper viator a latrone, non numquam etiam latro a viatore occiditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:21:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 21, 55</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cantabit vacuus coram latrone viator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:22" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:145" default="NO">13, 145</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quis fur esset, neu latro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin etiam leges latronum esse dicuntur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:11:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 11, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestio latronum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 16, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui latronem caedem sibi inferentem, occiderit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 23, 8</bibl></cit>.—Of an assassin, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:9:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 9, 4</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> of a hunter, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 7</bibl>.—Of a wolf, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 1, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26034.3" n="B" level="2"> For latrunculus, <hi rend="ital">a chessman, a piece in the game of draughts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">chess which represents a soldier; a man, pawn</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">latronum proelia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:357" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 357</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludere bella latronum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:20:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 20, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vitreo latrone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:72:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 72, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26035" type="main" key="La_^tro3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lā^tro</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26035.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname.</hi> So M. Porcius Latro, <hi rend="ital">a famous orator from Spain, a friend of the elder Seneca</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1 praef" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1 praef.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 5, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:91" default="NO">9, 2, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 14, 57, § 160</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n26035.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lătrō-nĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Latro, Latronian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:7:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 7, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:1" default="NO">1</bibl> praef. § 13.</sense></entryFree>
latrocinalis: <entryFree id="n26036" type="main" key="la_^tro_ci^na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lā^trōcĭnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. latro, II.</etym>, <sense id="n26036.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to robbers, robber-</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <trans><tr>a band of robbers</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 125, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lă-trōcĭnālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">after the manner of a robber, like a robber</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem interimere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 642</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
latrocinatio: <entryFree id="n26037" type="hapax" key="la_^tro_ci^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lā^trōcĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>latrocinor</etym>, <sense id="n26037.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a robbing, highway-robbery</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudinis saeva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 4, 19, § 59</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
latrocinium: <entryFree id="n26038" type="main" key="la_^tro_ci^ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lā^trōcĭnĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. * <sense id="n26038.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Military service</hi> for pay: apud regem in latrocinio fuisti, Plaut. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 134, 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26038.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26038.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Freebooting, robbery, highway-robbery, piracy</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum illum ex occultis insidiis in apertum latrocinium conjecimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fines suos ab latrociniis tueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugna latrocinio magis, quam proelio similis,</quote> <trans><tr>a contest with robbers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latrociniis magis quam justo bello gerebantur res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latrocinium potius quam bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latrociniis ac praedationibus infestatum mare,</quote> <trans><tr>piracies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:73:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 73, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 43, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">latrocinia nullam habent infamiam (apud Germanos),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 23, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui in furto aut in latrocinio aut aliqua noxa comprehensi,</quote> <trans><tr>in robbery</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 16</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>— </sense><sense id="n26038.3" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">villany, roguery, fraud</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">furtim et per latrocinia potius, quam bonis artibus, ad imperia et honores nituntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 4, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:22:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 22, 61</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26038.4" n="2" level="3"> Abstr. pro concreto, <hi rend="ital">a band of robbers</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ex tanto latrocinio unus tolletur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 13, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26038.5" n="C" level="2"> Latrocinii imago, <hi rend="ital">the semblance of freebooting</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the game of draughts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">chess, which imitates freebooting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive latrocinii sub imagine calculus ibit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 207</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
latrocinor: <entryFree id="n26039" type="main" key="la_^tro_ci^nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lā^trōcĭnor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>2. latro</etym>. <sense id="n26039.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To perform military service for pay, to be a hired soldier</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ibit aliquo Latrocinatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 198</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 19</bibl>: qui regi latrocinatus decem annos Demetrio, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=52" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 52</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n26039.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To practise freebooting, robbery</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">highway-robbery, to rob on the highway</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Catilina latrocinantem se interfici mallet, quam exsulem vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi impune sui posteri latrocinarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae instituta sic distant, ut Cretes et Aetoli latrocinari honestum putent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:9:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 9, 15</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">To commit piracy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">maritimi, alteri mercandi causa, alteri latrocinandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 4, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26039.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> * </sense><sense id="n26039.3" n="1" level="3"> Of a fish preying upon others, <hi rend="ital">to hunt, seize</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastinaca latrocinatur ex occulto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 42, 67, § 144</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n26039.4" n="2" level="3"> Of a physician who dissects a body: <cit><quote lang="la">mortui praecordia et viscus omne in conspectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1 praef.</bibl></cit>—Hence. <orth extent="full" lang="la">lā^trōcĭnanter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">adv., like a robber</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 35:3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 35, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
latronianus: <entryFree id="n26040" type="main" key="La_^tro_ni^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lā^trōnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 3. Latro.</entryFree>
latruncularius: <entryFree id="n26041" type="hapax" key="la_^truncu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lā^truncŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>latrunculus</etym>, <sense id="n26041.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to draughts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">chess</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabula,</quote> <trans><tr>a chess-board</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 117:30" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 117, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
latrunculator: <entryFree id="n26042" type="main" key="la_^truncu^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lā^truncŭlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>latrunculus, <cb n="LATU" /> I.</etym>, <sense id="n26042.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who tries cases of robbery, a larceny judge</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:1:61" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 5, 1, 61 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; Jul. Ep. Nov. c. 15, 60.</sense></entryFree>
latrunculus: <entryFree id="n26043" type="main" key="la_^truncu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lā^truncŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>2. latro</etym>. <sense id="n26043.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A highwayman, robber, freebooter, brigand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mastrucati latrunculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes sunt, quibus bellum publice populus Romanus decrevit, vel ipsi populo Romano, ceteri latrunculi vel praedones appellantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:15:24" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 15, 24</bibl></cit> (cf. the passage from <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:118" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 118</bibl>, where the word latrones is used; <cit><quote lang="la">v. 2. latro, II.): a latrunculis vel hostibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:5:34" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 39, 5, 34</bibl></cit>.—Of the usurper of a throne, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Firm. 2, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26043.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A man, pawn</hi>, in draughts or chess. latrunculis ludimus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 106:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 106, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 10:section=22" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 10, § 22</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 54, 80, § 215</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
latumiae: <entryFree id="n26044" type="main" key="la_tu^mi^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lātŭmĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, v. lautumiae <sense id="n26044.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
latura: <entryFree id="n26045" type="main" key="la_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fero</etym>, <sense id="n26045.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bearing, carry ing</hi> of burdens (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 345:3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 345, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Apoc. 14:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Apoc. 14, 3</bibl>: latura, <foreign lang="greek">fo/retron</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
laturarius: <entryFree id="n26046" type="main" key="la_tu_ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lātūrārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>latura</etym>, <sense id="n26046.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a carrier, porter</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 18:4" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 18, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:38:9" default="NO">38, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:60:8" default="NO">60, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
latus: <entryFree id="n26047" type="main" key="la_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>old Lat. stlātus, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=313" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 313</bibl>; Sanscr. root star-, strnāmi = sterno; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">stor</foreign>- in <foreign lang="greek">sto/rnumi, strato/s</foreign>; Lat. sterno, stratus, torus; cf. strāges, struo; not connected with <foreign lang="greek">platu/s</foreign>, nor with 3. lātus = <foreign lang="greek">tlhto/s</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n26047.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">broad, wide</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26047.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:46:section=103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 46, § 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 53</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">119: agri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:5:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 5, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clavus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:138" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 138</bibl></cit> (v. clavus): <cit><quote lang="la">umeri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:725" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 725</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">artus barbarorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lati et lacertosi viri,</quote> <trans><tr>broad-shouldered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:9:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 9, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:20:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 20, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rana bove latior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 24, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palus non latior pedibus quinquaginta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latissimum flumen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latissimae solitudines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comesse panem tris pedes latum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossae quindecim pedes latae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">areas latas pedum denum facito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:26" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 225</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia lata videt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 549</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latis otia fundis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:468" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 468</bibl></cit>: ne latos fines parare studeant. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:307" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 307</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lata Polyphemi acies,</quote> <trans><tr>wide eye</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:64" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 64</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Neutr. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crescere in latum,</quote> <trans><tr>to increase in width, widen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:336" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 336</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">per latum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:46:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 46, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in lato pedum centum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 26, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26047.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, for <hi rend="ital">proud, swelling</hi> (cf. Eng. vulg. <hi rend="ital">spreading</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">latus ut in circo spatiere,</quote> <trans><tr>that you may stalk along largely, proudly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lati incesserunt et cothurnati (histriones),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 76:31" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 76, 31</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n26047.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26047.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">broad, wide, wide-spread, extended</hi> (mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:82" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 82</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <trans><tr>pronounced broadly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:12:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 12, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloria,</quote> <trans><tr>widespread</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lato Murrus caligat in hoste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:499" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 499</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interpretatio,</quote> <trans><tr>broad, not strict, lenient</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:1:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 22, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culpa,</quote> <trans><tr>great</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:213" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 50, 16, 213</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:6:1" default="NO">11, 6, 1</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuga,</quote> <trans><tr>a kind of banishment, whereby all places are forbidden to the exile but one</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:22:5" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 48, 22, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26047.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of style, <hi rend="ital">diffuse, detailed, copious, prolix</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio Academicorum liberior et latior (opp. Stoicorum oratio astrictior et contractior),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:31:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 31, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latum atque fusum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:50" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latiore varioque tractatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latiore quadam comprehensione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus orandi latum et sonans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aeschines his latior et audentior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 23</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">broadly, widely, extensively;</hi> with longe, <hi rend="ital">on all sides, far and wide, everywhere</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26047.6" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">late longeque diffusus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:12:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 12, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus longe lateque aedificiis incensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minus late vagari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus late rex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">diu Lateque victrix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cladem inferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 23</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">latius demum operaest pretium ivisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque latius quam caedebatur ruebat (murus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">possidere (agros),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 43</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager latissime continuatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:26:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 26, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam latissime possint, ignes faciant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 9, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26047.7" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: ars late patet, <hi rend="ital">widely</hi>. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:55:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 55, 235</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phrygiae late refer primordia gentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 57</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">latius loquuntur rhetores, dialectici compressius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:6:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: quod <pb n="1042" /> <cb n="LATU" /> pateat latius, <hi rend="ital">of rather extensive application</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:4:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 4, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">latius perscribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti opibus,</quote> <trans><tr>more lavishly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 113</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidei bonae nomen latissime manat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:17:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 17, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latissime patere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 17, 69</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26048" type="main" key="la^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lătus</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">platu/s</foreign>; Lat. lăter, Latium, plautus or plotus</etym>, <sense id="n26048.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the side, flank</hi> of men or animals. </sense><sense id="n26048.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego vostra faciam latera lorea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: quid conminatu's mihi? <hi rend="ital">Con.</hi> Istud male factum arbitror, quia non latus fodi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">occidisse ex equo dicitur, et latus offendisse vehementer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:62:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 62, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus latus ille mucro petebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laterique accommodat ensem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:393" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 393</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 13, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:69" default="NO">11, 3, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:118" default="NO">118</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laterum inclinatione forti ac virili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 11, 18</bibl></cit>: vellere latus digitis, <hi rend="ital">to twitch one by the side</hi> (in order to attract attention), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:606" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 606</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si tetigit latus acrior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:109" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum latus ei dicenti condoluisse ... dieque septimo est lateris dolore consumptus,</quote> <trans><tr>pleurisy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">lateris dolor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 125</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8" default="NO" valid="yes">8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 21, 89, § 155</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lateris vigili cum febre dolor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:229" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 229</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">laterum dolor aut tussis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 32</bibl></cit>: artifices lateris, i. e. <hi rend="ital">those who make skilful side movements</hi> or <hi rend="ital">evolutions, ballet-dancers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:351" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 351</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">latus tegere alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to walk by the side of one</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">claudere alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:131" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 131</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">mares inter se uxoresque contendunt, uter det latus illis (sc. pantomimis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:32:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 7, 32, 3</bibl></cit>.—Of animals: <cit><quote lang="la">equorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1324" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1324</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus (equi aënei) in lateribus fores essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:9:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 9, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26048.2" n="2" level="3"> Of orators, <hi rend="ital">the lungs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lateribus aut clamore contendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:60:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 60, 255</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae vox, quae latera, quae vires, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:30:section=67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 30, § 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut lateris conatus sit ille, non capitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lateris pectorisve firmitas an capitis etiam plus adjuvet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 16</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum vox ac latus praeparetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:13" default="NO">11, 3, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">voce, latere, firmitate (constat orator),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim ex te umquam es nobilitatus, sed ex lateribus et lacertis tuis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum legem Voconiam voce magna et bonis lateribus suasissem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa adhuc audaciora et majorum, ut Cicero existimat, laterum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26048.3" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, in mal. part., Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 260, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 58</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">19, 138</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:2:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 2, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lateri parcere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:37" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26048.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen. </sense><sense id="n26048.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The side, flank, lateral surface</hi> of a thing (opp. frons and tergum; <cit><quote lang="la">v. h. vv.): collis ex utraque parte lateris dejectus habebat et in frontem leniter fastigatus paulatim ad planiciem redibat,</quote> <trans><tr>on each side</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 23, 35, § 202</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra angusta verticibus, lateribus latior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:20:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 20, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latus unum castrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insula, cujus unum latus est contra Galliam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et (Fibrenus) divisus aequaliter in duas partis latera haec (insulae) adluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>.—Of a maritime country, <hi rend="ital">the coast, seaboard</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Illyricum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:117" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum prora avertit et undis Dat latus,</quote> <trans><tr>the ship's side</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi pulsarunt acres latera ardua fluctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:529" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 529</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudum remigio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 14, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:10:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 10, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextrum (domus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:22:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 22, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crystallus sexangulis nascitur lateribus,</quote> <trans><tr>surfaces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 9, § 26</bibl></cit>.—Of an army, <hi rend="ital">the flank</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquos equites ad latera disponit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex itinere nostros latere aperto aggressi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 23</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad latus apertum hostium constitui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne simul in frontem, simul in latera, pugnaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 35</bibl></cit>.—So in fighting: latus dare, <hi rend="ital">to expose one's side</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flank</hi> to the adversary, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:304" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 304</bibl> (v. II. A. infra).— </sense><sense id="n26048.6" n="b" level="4"> Esp. freq.: a (ab) latere, <hi rend="ital">on</hi> or <hi rend="ital">at the side</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flank;</hi> a or ab lateribus, <hi rend="ital">on</hi> or <hi rend="ital">at the sides</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flanks</hi> (opp. a fronte, <hi rend="ital">in front, before</hi>, and a tergo, <hi rend="ital">at the back, behind</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">a tergo, a fronte, a lateribus tenebitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 13, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a fronte atque ab utroque latere cratibus ac pluteis protegebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 2, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab omni latere securus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab latere aggredi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disjectos ab tergo aut lateribus circumveniebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 50 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quis inermibus militibus ab latere impetus fieri posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sulla profligatis iis, quos advorsum ierat, rediens ab latere Mauris incurrit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 101:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 101, 8</bibl></cit>: si ex <cb n="LAUD" /> hac causa unda prorumperet, a lateribus undae circumfunderentur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:6:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 6, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a lateribus, a fronte, quasi tria maria prospectat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26048.7" n="c" level="4"> Less freq. with <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">latere ex utroque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1049" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1049</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex lateribus aggredi aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribus ex lateribus (locus) tegebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Alex. 28:4" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Alex. 28, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex alio latere cubiculum est politissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omni ex latere armorum molibus urgeri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 7, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26048.8" n="d" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de latere ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 117</bibl></cit>.—Without <pos>prep.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">alio latere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 74</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26048.9" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> (pars pro toto), <hi rend="ital">the body</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">penna latus vestit, tenet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:376" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 376</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc latus in fulvis niveum deponit harenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:865" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 865</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 23</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">14, 710: forte,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fessum longā militiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">credidit tauro latus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 27, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liminis aut aquae Caelestis patiens latus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 10, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26048.10" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26048.11" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: in latera atque in terga incurrere, <hi rend="ital">to attack the sides</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the unguarded points</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliena negotia centum Per caput et circa saliunt latus,</quote> <trans><tr>encompass on every side</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut a senis latere numquam discederem,</quote> <trans><tr>never left his side</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: aliquem lateri alicujus adjungere, <hi rend="ital">to attach to his side</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to give him for a companion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 5</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">alicui latus dare, of a client,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:32:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 7, 32, 3</bibl></cit> (cf. B. 1. infra): <cit><quote lang="la">lateri adhaerere gravem dominum,</quote> <trans><tr>hung about them, threatened them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Illyriorum rex, lateri ejus haerens, assiduis precibus promissa exigebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:4:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 29, 4, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Agathocles regis lateri junctus, civitatem regebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 30, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumfusa turba lateri meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 15</bibl></cit>.—Esp.: <cit><quote lang="la">sacpe dabis nudum latus,</quote> <trans><tr>expose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:52" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">la. tus imperii nudum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:5:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec adulatoribus latus praebeas,</quote> <trans><tr>expose yourself, lay yourself open to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4 praef" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4 praef.</bibl></cit>: latere tecto abscedere, i. e <hi rend="ital">safe, unharmed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic fugit omnes Insidias nullique malo latus obdit apertum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex uno latere constat contractus,</quote> <trans><tr>on one side</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:1:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 1, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:5:5" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3, 5, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla ex utroque latere nascitur actio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:5:6:section=4" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3, 5, 6, § 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26048.12" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n26048.13" n="1" level="3"> To express <hi rend="ital">intimacy, attachment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">latus alicui cingere,</quote> <trans><tr>to cling to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:39:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 39, 8</bibl></cit>; esp. in the phrase: ab latere, <hi rend="ital">at the side</hi> of, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in intimate association</hi> with (rare, and perh. not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ab latere tyranni: addit eos ab latere tyranni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 5, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:5:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 5, 15</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ille tuum, Castrice, dulce latus,</quote> <trans><tr>your constant associate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:68:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 68, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26048.14" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Relationship, kindred</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">collateral relationship</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (liberis) videor a meo tuoque latere pronum ad honores iter relicturus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt et ex lateribus cognati ut fratres sororesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:10:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 10, § 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex latere uxorem ducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:2:68" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 23, 2, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latus omne divinae domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5 praef" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5 praef.</bibl></cit>: omnes personae cognatorum aut supra numerantur, aut infra, aut ex transverso, sive a latere ... a latere, fratres et sorores, liberique eorum; item parentium fratres et sorores liberique eorum, (Ulp.) de Grad. Cogn. 2 ap. Huschke, Jurisp. Antejust. p. 530.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n26049" type="main" key="la_tus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. fero.</entryFree>
latusculum: <entryFree id="n26050" type="main" key="la^tuscu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lătuscŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>2. latus</etym>, <sense id="n26050.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little side</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">laneum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:25:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 25, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">speculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:335" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 335</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
laudabilis: <entryFree id="n26051" type="main" key="lauda_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laudābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>laudo</etym>, <sense id="n26051.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be praised, praiseworthy, laudable</hi> (class. and freq.). </sense><sense id="n26051.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudabile est, quod conficit honestam et praesentem et consequentem commemorationem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honestum, etiam si a nullo laudetur, natura esse laudabile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:95:325" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 95, 325</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">oratores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 97, 333</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir erga rempublicam, Treb. Poll. Trig. Tyr. 32, 2: civis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:84" default="NO">3, 6, 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:408" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 408</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:14:35" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 14, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Rutilo luxuria est: in Ventidio laudabile nomen sumit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:22" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 22</bibl></cit>.— As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">laudābĭle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the praiseworthy</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct.
