Her.</author> 3, 4, 7</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae ratio laudabilior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(voluptas) melioremne efficit aut laudabiliorem virum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:chapter=1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 1</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multo modestia post victoriam, quam ipsa victoria, laudabilior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26051.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">valuable, precious, excellent</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">mel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 15, 15, § 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 4, 3, § 28</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudabilius vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 3, 4, § 36</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">laudābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a praiseworthy<cb n="LAUD" />  manner, praiseworthily, laudably</hi>, ad recte, honeste, laudabiliter, postremo ad bene vivendum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:5:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 5, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudabiliter ac placabiliter propitiandi judices,</quote> <trans><tr>by flattering expressions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudabilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:1:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">ext.;</hi> 5, 4, 3.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> of the <pos>adj.</pos> and <pos>adv.</pos> appear not to occur.</sense></entryFree>
laudabilitas: <entryFree id="n26052" type="main" key="lauda_bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laudābĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>laudo</etym>, <sense id="n26052.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">laudability, excellency</hi>, a title of the Comes Metallorum: tua, Cod. Th. 10, 19, 3.</sense></entryFree>
laudabiliter: <entryFree id="n26053" type="main" key="lauda_bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laudābĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. laudabilis <sense id="n26053.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
laudate: <entryFree id="n26054" type="main" key="lauda_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laudātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. laudo <sense id="n26054.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
laudatio: <entryFree id="n26055" type="main" key="lauda_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laudātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>laudo</etym>, <sense id="n26055.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a praising, praise, commendation; a eulogy, panegyric</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26055.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: quam lauream cum tua laudatione conferrem? <hi rend="ital">with your eulogy</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">that pronounced by you</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 6, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">felicitatem ipsam deorum immortalium judicio tribui laudationis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:85:347" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 85, 347</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae quidem laudatio hominis turpissimi mihi ipsi erat paene turpis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:29:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 29, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in omnibus laudationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:153" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 153</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">object.-gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudationes eorum, qui sunt ab Homero laudati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:35:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 35, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudationes modulatae,</quote> <trans><tr>songs of praise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26055.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n26055.3" n="A" level="2"> In a court of justice, <hi rend="ital">a favorable testimony</hi> to a person's character, <hi rend="ital">a eulogy, panegyric</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectissimos viros cum legatione ad hoc judicium, et cum gravissima atque ornatissima laudatione miserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 15, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicialis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 56</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26055.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A funeral oration, eulogy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">funebris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 13, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">est in manibus laudatio, quam cum legimus, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonnullae mortuorum laudationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:16:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 16, 61</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">object.-gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">matronarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 50</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
laudativus: <entryFree id="n26056" type="main" key="lauda_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laudātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, in rhet. lang. of Quintilian, <sense id="n26056.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to praise, laudatory</hi>: est unum genus, quo laus et vituperatio continetur, sed est appellatum a meliore parte laudativum: idem alii demonstrativum vocant: utrumque nomen ex Graeco creditur fluxisse: nam et <foreign lang="greek">e)gkwmiastiko\n</foreign> et <foreign lang="greek">e)pideiktiko\n</foreign> dicunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:4:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 4, 12</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 7, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">materia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:4:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 4, 16</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n26056.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">laudātīva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">commendation</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">laudativa tota, quae est rhetorices pars tertia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:3:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 3, 14</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">laudātīvē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">adv., in a laudatory manner</hi>, Don. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Enn. 5, 8, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
laudator: <entryFree id="n26057" type="main" key="lauda_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laudātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26057.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a praiser; a eulogizer, panegyrist</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n26057.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">integritatis et elegantiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctores et laudatores voluptatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum mearum gestarum laudatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Red. in Sen. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporis acti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">derisor vero plus laudatore movetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 433</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:21:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 21, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:41:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 41, 90</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26057.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n26057.3" n="A" level="2"> In a court of justice, <hi rend="ital">one who bears favorable testimony</hi> to the character of the accused, <hi rend="ital">a eulogizer, panegyrist</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">excitabo laudatores, quos ad hoc judicium ... deprecatores hujus periculi missos videtis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:18:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 18, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:22:section=57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 22, § 57</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n26057.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">One who pronounces a funeral oration</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
laudatorius: <entryFree id="n26058" type="main" key="lauda_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laudātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26058.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to praise, laudatory</hi> (late Lat.), Fulg. Myth. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
laudatrix: <entryFree id="n26059" type="main" key="lauda_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laudātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>laudator</etym>, <sense id="n26059.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who praises</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">vitiorum laudatrix fama popularis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 126</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
laudatus: <entryFree id="n26060" type="main" key="lauda_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laudātus</orth>, <itype>a, am</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from laudo.</entryFree>
laudiceni: <entryFree id="n26061" type="main" key="Laudi^ce_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Laudĭcēni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, collat. form of Laodiceni, v. Laodicea, II. B.—Hence, <sense id="n26061.0" n="II" level="1"> In a pun, of parasites [laudo-cena], <hi rend="ital">dinnerchanters, who give applause for a dinner</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 14, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
laudidignus: <entryFree id="n26062" type="gloss" key="laudi^dignus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laudĭdignus</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">e)painou a)/cios</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
laudifico: <entryFree id="n26063" type="gloss" key="laudi^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laudĭfĭco</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">u(mnw=</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
laudo: <entryFree id="n26064" type="main" key="laudo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laudo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>laus</etym>, <sense id="n26064.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to praise, laud, commend, extol, eulogize, approve</hi> (cf.: celebro, praed co). </sense><sense id="n26064.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26064.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: omnes mortales sese laudarier optant, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Trin. 13:6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Trin. 13, 6</bibl> (Ann. v. 551 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">coram in os te laudare,</quote> <trans><tr>to praise to one's face</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 4, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in faciem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 14, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vituperare improbos asperius, laudare bonos ornatius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:chapter=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2</bibl></cit>, <pb n="1043" /> <cb n="LAUR" /> 9, 35: <cit><quote lang="la">et efferre aliquid,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 75, 304</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 20, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiam alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:34:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 34, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudantur exquisitissimis verbis legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 4, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legem ipsam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnifice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:73:254" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 73, 254</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agricolam laudat juris peritus,</quote> <trans><tr>praises him as happy, extols his happiness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 9</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">diversa sequentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; 109: volucrem laudamus equum, <hi rend="ital">praise as swift</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">for swiftness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:57" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudatur dis aequa potestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 71</bibl></cit>.—<mood>Part.</mood> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prava laudantium sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 123:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 123, 9</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam praestantibus viris laudata est in una sententia perpetua permansio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Germanicus cunctis laudatus,</quote> <trans><tr>by all</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 57 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba laudata Eratostheni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 22, 43, § 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudataque quondam ora Jovi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:480" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 480</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n26064.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">object.-gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudabat leti juvenem,</quote> <trans><tr>pronounced him happy on account of his death</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:260" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 260</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26064.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo tuum consilium nemo potest non maxime laudare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenes laudari in bonis gaudent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 12, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scriptores iamborum saepe in illis laudantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26064.5" n="(d)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">extinxisse nefas Laudabor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:585" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 585</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">quod</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod viris fortibus honos habitus est, laudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:47:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 47, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudat Africanum Panaetius, quod fuerit abstinens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:22:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 22, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamne igitur laudas, quod de sapientibus alter Ridebat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:28" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non laudans, quod non in melius, sed in deterius, convenitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:11:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 11, 17</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">quoniam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrumque laudemus, quoniam per illos ne haec quidem genera laude caruerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:30:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 30, 116</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">te quidem, cum isto animo es, satis laudare non possum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:36:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 36, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam id ipsum consul laudare, cum initiatam se (Hispala) non infitiaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 12, 7</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">q</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">si</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium laudo artificis, si munere tanto Praecipuam in tabulis ceram senis abstulit orbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:18" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26064.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n26064.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To pronounce a funeral oration over</hi> a person: <cit><quote lang="la">quem cum supremo ejus die Maximus laudaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:36:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 36, 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 8, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26064.8" n="2" level="3"> In medicine, <hi rend="ital">to recommend as a remedy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apri cerebrum contra serpentes laudatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 10, 42, § 152</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:54" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 3, 12, § 54</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26064.9" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To praise, compliment</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">dismiss with a compliment, leave, turn from</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">laudato ingentia rura, Exiguum colito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:412" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 412</bibl></cit>: cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">probitas laudatur et alget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:74" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 74</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n26064.10" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to adduce, name, quote, cite</hi> a person as any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">laudare significat priscā linguā nominare appellareque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:6:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 6, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: laudare ponebatur apud antiquos pro nominare, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=118" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 118</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">id ut scias, Jovem supremum testem laudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem rerum Romanarum auctorem laudare possum religiosissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:11:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 11, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:18:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 18, 68</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut auctoribus laudandis ineptiarum crimen effugiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 49, 187</bibl></cit>: auctore laudato, Cod. 8, 45, 7.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">laudātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., extolled, praiseworthy, esteemed, excellent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudari a laudato viro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 7</bibl></cit>; Naev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 6, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium laudatarum artium procreatrix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc ubi laudatos jactantem in sanguine vultus videt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olus laudatum in cibis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 22, 33, § 74</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saccharon et Arabia fert, sed laudatius India,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 8, 17, § 32</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudatissimus caseus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 42, 97, § 241</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo laudatissima formae dote,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:715" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 715</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">laudātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">laudably, admirably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regias domos laudatissime ebore adornans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 6, 5, § 46</bibl></cit> (al. lautissime).</sense></entryFree>
laurago: <entryFree id="n26065" type="main" key="laura_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laurāgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>laurus</etym>, <sense id="n26065.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant of the laurel kind</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 58</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
laurea: <entryFree id="n26066" type="main" key="laure^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laurĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. laureus, II.</entryFree>
laureatus: <entryFree id="n26067" type="main" key="laure^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laurĕātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>laurea</etym>, <sense id="n26067.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">crowned</hi> or <hi rend="ital">decked with laurel, laureate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">imago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:41:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 41, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lictores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fasces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:28:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 28, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 39</bibl></cit>: litterae, <hi rend="ital">a letter announcing a victory</hi> (so called because bound up with bay-leaves), <hi rend="ital">a laurelled letter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae a Postumio laureatae sequuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">laurĕātae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype> (sc. litterae), <hi rend="ital">a letter announcing a</hi> <cb n="LAUR" /> <hi rend="ital">victory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne laureatis quidem gesta prosecutus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. laurus.</sense></entryFree>
laurentum: <entryFree id="n26068" type="main" key="Laurentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Laurentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n26068.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maritime town in Latium, between Ostia and Lavinium</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Torre Paterno</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 9</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n26068.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Laurens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n26068.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Laurentum, Laurentian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Laurens Thybris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:797" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 797</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 661</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Turnus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 650</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:107" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 107</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:13:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 13, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">castrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:49" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 49</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Laurens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an estate (of the younger Pliny) near Laurentum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 1</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Laurentes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Laurentines</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Laurentum Troumque acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 137</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and of the Laurentes who were incorporated in Lavinium (v. Laurolavinium): Laurentes Lavinates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 1:71" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 1, 71</bibl></cit>; Inscr. ap. Grut. 1101, 8; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2174</bibl> sqq.; 3888.—</sense><sense id="n26068.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., <hi rend="ital">Roman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:83" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeda,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>that taken by Hannibal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:282" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17, 282</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n26068.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Laurentīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Laurentine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:37" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:5:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 5, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Laurentīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. praedium), <hi rend="ital">the younger Pliny's estate near Laurentum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 1</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n26068.5" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lau-rentĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Laurentian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palus Laurentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:709" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 709</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n26068.6" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lau-rentis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <hi rend="ital">adj., Laurentian</hi>: Laurentis terra, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 762</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 35 Vahl.).</sense></entryFree>
laureola: <entryFree id="n26069" type="main" key="laure^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laurĕŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>laurea</etym>, lit., <sense id="n26069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little laurel crown</hi> or <hi rend="ital">garland;</hi> hence, transf., <hi rend="ital">a little triumph</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod esset ad laureolam satis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 10, 2</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">laureolam in mustaceo quaerere (a laurel branch in a laurel cake),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to seek fame in trifles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 20, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
laureolus: <entryFree id="n26070" type="main" key="Laure^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Laurĕŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26070.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a notorious robber, who is said to have been crucified and torn to pieces by wild beasts; hero of a play by the mimographer Q. Lutatius Catulus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:187" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 187</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Spect. 7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Spect. 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:57" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lauretum: <entryFree id="n26071" type="main" key="Laure_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Laurētum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Lōrētum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>laurus</etym>, <sense id="n26071.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a laurel-grove</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26071.1" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">Lauretum</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Laurel-grove</hi>, a place on the Aventine Hill, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=152" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 152</bibl> Müll.—Form Loretum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 30, 40, § 138</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
laureus: <entryFree id="n26072" type="main" key="laure^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laurĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26072.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of laurel, laurel-</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26072.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectes laurei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in nitidā laurea serta comā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:172" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <trans><tr>laurel-oil</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 13, 51, § 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 30, 40, § 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:81" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pira,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>that smell like laurel</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerasa,</quote> <trans><tr>grafted on laurel</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 25, 30, § 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:92:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 92, 11</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n26072.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">laurĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n26072.3" n="A" level="2"> (Sc. arbor.) <hi rend="ital">The laurel-tree</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laurea in puppi navis longae enata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum spissa ramis laurea fervidos Excludet ictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 15, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">factis modo laurea ramis annuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:566" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 566</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex Pannonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:8:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 8, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26072.4" n="B" level="2"> (Sc. corona.) <hi rend="ital">A laurel crown</hi> or <hi rend="ital">garland, laurel branch</hi>, as the ornament of Apollo, of poets, of ancestral images, of generals enjoying a triumph, and of letters containing news of a victory: <cit><quote lang="la">te precor, o vates, assit tua laurea nobis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laureā donandus Apollinari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cedant arma togae, concedat laurea linguae, Cic. poët. Off. 1, 22, 77: quam lauream cum tua laudatione conferam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 6, 1</bibl></cit>. Sometimes victorious generals, instead of a triumphal procession, contented themselves with carrying a laurel branch to the Capitol: <cit><quote lang="la">de Cattis Dacisque duplicem triumphum egit: de Sarmatis lauream modo Capitolino Jovi retulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem praetextatus et laurea coronatus intravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:8" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">thyrsus enim vobis, gestata est laurea nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:5:67" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 5, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellorum laureas victori tradens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:4:17" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 14, 4, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26072.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a victory, triumph</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">primus in toga triumphum linguaeque lauream merite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 30, 31, § 117</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">parite laudem et lauream,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 3, 53</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
laurex: <entryFree id="n26073" type="foreign" key="laurex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laurex</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">laurix</orth>), <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (Balearic), <sense id="n26073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a young rabbit cut out from the mother, or taken from her teats</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 55, 81, § 217</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lauricomus: <entryFree id="n26074" type="hapax" key="lauri^co^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laurĭcŏmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>laurus-coma</etym>, <sense id="n26074.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">laurel-haired, covered with laurels</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 152</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
laurifer: <entryFree id="n26075" type="main" key="lauri^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laurĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>laurus-fero</etym>. <sense id="n26075.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Laurel-bearing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15</bibl></cit>, <cb n="LAUS" /> 30, 40, § 134.—</sense><sense id="n26075.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Laurel-crowned</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">currus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:332" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 332</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lauriger: <entryFree id="n26076" type="main" key="lauri^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laurĭger</orth>, <itype>gĕra, gĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>laurus-gero</etym>, <sense id="n26076.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">laurel-bearing, crowned</hi> or <hi rend="ital">decked with laurel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phoebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:389" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 389</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 6, 54: <cit><quote lang="la">cuspis,</quote> <trans><tr>a lance wound round with laurel</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:6:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:422" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 422</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
laurinus: <entryFree id="n26077" type="main" key="lauri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laurīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>laurus</etym>, <sense id="n26077.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of laurel, laurel-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">folium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 8, 18, § 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 4, 43, § 86</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lauriotis: <entryFree id="n26078" type="main" key="lauri^o_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laurĭōtis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lauriw=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n26078.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">from Laurion, in Attica</hi>, where there were silver mines; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, spodos,</quote> <trans><tr>the ashes which, in smelting silver, remain in the furnace, dross, scoria</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 13, 34, § 132</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lauripotens: <entryFree id="n26079" type="main" key="lauri^po^tens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laurĭpŏtens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>laurus-potens</etym>, <sense id="n26079.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lord of laurels, laurel-ruler</hi>, an epithet of Apollo, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
laurolavinium: <entryFree id="n26080" type="main" key="Lauro^la_vi_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Laurŏlāvīnĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n26080.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a later name of the city Lavinium, after (about the time of the Antonines) the inhabitants of Laurentum were transplanted thither</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:de Colon. p. 105" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> de Colon. p. 105</bibl> Goes.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 7, 59</bibl>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Laurens Lāvīnāris</orth>, <itype>Laurentis Lavinaris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an inhabitant of Lauro-Lavinium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 1:71" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 1, 71</bibl> (v. Laurentum, A. 1. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
lauron: <entryFree id="n26081" type="main" key="Lauro_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Laurōn</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n26081.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:22:7" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 22, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:86" default="NO">4, 2, 86</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n26081.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Laurōnensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Lauronian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 71</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
laurus: <entryFree id="n26082" type="main" key="laurus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laurus</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (<sense id="n26082.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> laurūs, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 30, 39, § 132</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:112" default="NO" valid="yes">14, 16, 19, § 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:7:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 7, 3</bibl> <hi rend="ital">codd.; abl.</hi> lauru, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 7, 19</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">but lauro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 30, 16</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">nom. plur.</hi> laurus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 91</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">acc. plur.</hi> laurus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:83 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 6, 83 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:63" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 63</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> lauruum, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 110</bibl> P.), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cf. Germ. lor- in Lorbeere</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a bay-tree, laurel-tree, laurel</hi>, sacred to Apollo; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid cedo Qui vicini hanc nostram augeam aram Apollinis. Da sane hanc virgam lauri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 4, 1, 11</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">it grew in greatest beauty on Parnassus, and hence is called Parnasia laurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 18</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">its branches were the decoration of poets,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the flamens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:137" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 137</bibl>. In festivals, the ancestral images were decorated with laurel, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 41</bibl>. The leaves, when eaten, were said to impart the power of prophesying, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:63" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:19" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 19</bibl>. Victorious generals, in triumphal processions, wore laurel crowns on their heads and carried laurel branches in their hands, while their lictors bore fasces bound with laurel, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:560" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 560</bibl>. Before the gate of the imperial palace stood two laurel-trees, with oaken crowns, in honor of the emperor, as the vanquisher of foes and the people's preserver: <cit><quote lang="la">janitrix Caesarum et pontificum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 30, 39, § 127</bibl></cit> sqq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 35</bibl>. A wet branch of laurel was used in lustrations, to sprinkle the objects to be purified: <cit><quote lang="la">cuperent lustrari ... si foret umida laurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:158" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 158</bibl></cit>; cf. Dict. Antiq. s. v. lustratio.—</sense><sense id="n26082.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> for laurea, <hi rend="ital">a laurel crown</hi>, as the sign of a triumph; hence for <hi rend="ital">triumph, victory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incurrit haec nostra laurus non solum in oculos, sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parthica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:14" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Indica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:1:4" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sarmatica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:6:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornari lauro secunda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:253" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 253</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
laus: <entryFree id="n26083" type="main" key="laus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laus</orth>, <itype>laudis</itype> (<sense id="n26083.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> laudium, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 23, 32</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>for claus, from clavid, kindred to cluo and the Greek <foreign lang="greek">kle/vos</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">praise, commendation, glory, fame, renown, esteem</hi> (cf.: gloria, praeconium, elogium). </sense><sense id="n26083.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in laude vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut is cum populo Romano et in laude et in gratia esse possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:17:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 17, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum te (omnes) summis laudibus ad caelum extulerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divinis laudibus ornare aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bruti nostri cotidianis assiduisque laudibus, quas ab eo de nobis haberi permulti mihi renuntiaverunt, commotum istum aliquando scripsisse ad me credo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:38:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 38, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laude afficere aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:13:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 13, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omni laude cumulare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:26:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 26, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summam alicui laudem tribuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illustri laude celebrari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximam laudem ex re aliqua sibi parere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:13:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 13, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornare aliquem suis laudibus et onerare alienis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem laudibus efferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:182" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ego hoc in tua laude pono,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3</bibl></cit>, <pb n="1044" /> <cb n="LAUT" /> 91, § <cit><quote lang="la">212. Fabio laudi datum est, quod pingeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentiae, humanitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:23:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 23, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevitas laus est interdum in aliqua parte dicendi, in universa eloquentia laudem non habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:13:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 13, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudis titulique cupido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:143" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supremae laudes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a funeral oration</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 43, 45, § 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiatam memoriam funebribus laudibus reor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 40</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n26083.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26083.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A praiseworthy thing, a ground for praise, a laudable</hi> or <hi rend="ital">glorious action, a laudable enterprise; a merit, desert</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">abundans bellicis laudibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:22:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 22, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostras laudes in astra sustulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 25, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa laus tua et Bruti est, quod exercitum praeter spem existimamini comparasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ceteris tuis laudibus, hanc esse vel maximam, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:73:296" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 73, 296</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna laus, et grata hominibus, unum hominem elaborare, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 9, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Suevi maximam putant esse laudem, vacare agros, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pericles hac laude (dicendi) clarissimus fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:7:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 7, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:355" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 355</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 461</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conferre nostris tu potes te laudibus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 23, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conscientia laudis,</quote> <trans><tr>worth, desert</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2</bibl></cit>, epil. 11: <cit><quote lang="la">te censeri laude tuorum noluerim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:74" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 74</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26083.4" n="B" level="2"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">estimation, worth, value, repute</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">Cois amphoris laus est maxima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 12, 46, § 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coccum Galatiae in maxima laude est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 41, 65, § 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peculiaris laus ejus, quod fatigato corpori succurrit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 22, 38, § 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Creticae cotes diu maximam laudem habuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 22, 47, § 164</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26084" type="main" key="Laus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Laus</orth>, <itype>Laudis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n26084.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of several cities</hi>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">a city in Cisalpine Gaul, northwest of Placentia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Lodi Vecchia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 15, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also called Laus Pompeia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 17, 21, § 124</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lausus: <entryFree id="n26085" type="main" key="Lausus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lausus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n26085.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Numitor and brother of Rhea Silvia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:55" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 55</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26085.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The son of Mezentius, whom Æneas slew</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:649" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 649</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 790</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
laute: <entryFree id="n26086" type="main" key="laute_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lautē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. lavo <sense id="n26086.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
lautia: <entryFree id="n26087" type="main" key="lauti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lautĭa</orth> (in Plutarch <foreign lang="greek">lau/teia</foreign>, Quaest. Rom. 45; old form: dautia quae lautia dicimus et dantur legatis hospitii gratia, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=68" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 68</bibl> Müll.), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>lautus, v. lavo <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></etym>, <sense id="n26087.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the entertainment furnished in Rome to foreign ambassadors or distinguished guests at the expense of the state</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26087.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus inde lautiaque legatis praeberi jussa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:39:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 39, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:17:14" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 17, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 24, 5</bibl>; 35, 23, 11; 42, 6, 11; 42, 19, 6.—</sense><sense id="n26087.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 221, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equum illum hospitium, ac loca lautia mihi praebiturum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3</bibl></cit>, p. 140, 33; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 8, 361</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lautitas: <entryFree id="n26088" type="greek" key="lauti^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lautĭtas</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">polute/leia</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.; cf. the foll. art.</entryFree>
lautitia: <entryFree id="n26089" type="main" key="lauti^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lautĭtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>lautus</etym>, <sense id="n26089.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">elegance, splendor, magnificence</hi> in one's style of living, in one's house, furniture, food, etc. </sense><sense id="n26089.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 114:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 114, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama ad te de mea nova lautitia veniet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 16, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse in lautitiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accuratissimae lautitiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa cenarum lautitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 12, 46, § 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lautitiae causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 6, 5, § 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munditiarum lautitiarumque studiosissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:46" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 46</bibl></cit>: lautitia, epularum magnificentia, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=117" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 117</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n26089.2" n="II" level="1"> Lautitia farina appelabatur ex tritico aqua consperso, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=118" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 118</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
lautiusculus: <entryFree id="n26090" type="hapax" key="lauti^uscu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lautĭuscŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n26090.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">somewhat splendid</hi> or <hi rend="ital">magnificent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 191, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lautulae: <entryFree id="n26091" type="main" key="Lautu^lae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lautŭlae</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Lautŏlae</orth>), <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>lavo</etym>. <sense id="n26091.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A place in Rome where there were warm baths</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=156" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 156</bibl> Müll. Acc. to Servius, <hi rend="ital">the place where the Sabines, in pursuit of the Romans, were stopped by the gushing forth of a hot spring</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 8, 361</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n26091.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Latium, between Anxur and Fundi, with warm baths</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:39:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 39, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 23, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lautumiae: <entryFree id="n26092" type="main" key="lautu^mi^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lautŭmĭae</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">lātŏmĭae</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">lātŭ-mĭae</orth>), <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">latomi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n26092.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stone-quarry</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26092.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">vel in lautumiis vel in pistrino mavelim Agere aetatem, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latomiae lapidariae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 65</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26092.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a prison cut out of the rock</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26092.3" n="A" level="2"> At Syracuse: <cit><quote lang="la">carcer Syracusis vocantur latomiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=151" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 151</bibl></cit> Müll.; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">in the foll.</ref></xr>: lautumias Syracusanas omnes audistis, Cic. <cb n="LAVI" /> Verr. 2, 5, 27, § 68; 2, 5, 57, § 148.—</sense><sense id="n26092.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The state prison in Rome, on the north-eastern side of the capitol, usually called</hi> Tullianum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=151" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 151</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">principes Aetolorum Romam deducti et in Lautumias conjecti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 27, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:26:17" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 26, 17</bibl>; 39, 44, 7.</sense></entryFree>
lautumius: <entryFree id="n26093" type="hapax" key="lautu^mi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lautŭmĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lautumiae</etym>, <sense id="n26093.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a stone-quarry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carcer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 17</bibl></cit>; cf. the preced. art. II.</sense></entryFree>
lautumus: <entryFree id="n26094" type="main" key="lautu^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lautŭmus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">lātŏmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26094.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stonecutter</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 3</bibl>, Reg. 5, 15; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:22:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 Par. 22, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lautus: <entryFree id="n26095" type="main" key="lautus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lautus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from lavo.</entryFree>
lavabrum: <entryFree id="n26096" type="main" key="la^va_brum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăvābrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype> <etym>lavo; fuller form of labrum</etym>, <sense id="n26096.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bathing-tub</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si calidis cunctare lavabris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:799" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 799</bibl></cit>; cf. Mar. Victorin. 2457 P.</sense></entryFree>
lavacrum: <entryFree id="n26097" type="main" key="la^va_crum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăvācrum</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">lăvăcrum</orth>, Ven. Carm. 5, 5, 96), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>lavo</etym>, <sense id="n26097.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bath</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lavacra pro sexibus separavit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lavacra in modum provinciarum exstructa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 10, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cor. 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferventia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:11:134" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 11, 134</bibl></cit>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,017:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Tit. 3, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lavandaria: <entryFree id="n26098" type="hapax" key="la^vanda_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăvandārĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26098.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">things to be washed</hi>: lavandaria dicit, quae ad lavandum sint data, Laber. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:7:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 7, 5</bibl> (Inc. Fab. XVII. Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
lavatio: <entryFree id="n26099" type="main" key="la^va_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăvātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26099.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a washing, bathing, bath</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26099.1" n="I" level="1"> In abstr.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ea messis attinet ad meam lavationem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; Cic. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:3:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lavatio calida et pueris et senibus apta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3:section=71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 3, § 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:79" default="NO" valid="yes">79</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">boves lavatione calidae aquae traduntur pinguescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 45, 70, § 178</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n26099.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26099.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Bathing apparatus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut lavatio parata sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 5, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:25:section=10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 25, § 10</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n26099.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A bathing-place, bathing-room, bath</hi>: in versura porticus frigida lavatio, quam Graeci <foreign lang="greek">loutro\n</foreign> vocitant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:30:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 30, § 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 444, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">473, 1 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
lavator: <entryFree id="n26100" type="gloss" key="la^va_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăvātor</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">plu/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n26100.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a clothes-washer</hi>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
lavatorium: <entryFree id="n26101" type="gloss" key="la^va_to_rium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăvātōrium</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">plu/simon</foreign>, locus ad lavandum, Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
lavatrina: <entryFree id="n26102" type="main" key="la^va_tri_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăvātrīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. latrina.</entryFree>
laver: <entryFree id="n26103" type="main" key="la^ver"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăver</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n26103.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a water-plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 32, § 50</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also sion,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 22, 41, § 84</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
laverna: <entryFree id="n26104" type="main" key="La^verna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăverna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n26104.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the patron goddess of gain</hi> (lawful or unlawful), <hi rend="ital">and hence especially of rogues and thieves</hi>, Nov. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 483, 21</bibl> (Com. Fragm. v. 105 Rib.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 2, 31</bibl>: mihi, Laverna, in furtis celerassis manus, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 134, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:ib. 135:1" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> ib. 135, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulcra Laverna, da mihi fallere, da justo sanctoque videri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 60</bibl></cit>: Laverna in via Salaria lucum habet, Est autem dea furum et simulacrum ejus fures colunt, et qui consilia sua volunt tacita, nam preces ejus cum silentio exercentur, Schol. Cruq. ad Hor. l. l.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n26104.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăvernālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Laverna, Lavernal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Porta,</quote> <trans><tr>a gate in Rome where stood an altar of Laverna</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=163" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 163</bibl></cit> Müll.; Paul. ex Fest. s. h. v. p. 117 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
laverniones: <entryFree id="n26105" type="gloss" key="la^verni^o_nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăvernĭōnes</orth> <itype>fures antiqui dicebant, quod sub tutela deae Lavernae essent, in cujus luco obscuro abditoque solitos furta praedamque inter se luere</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=117" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 117</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
lavernium: <entryFree id="n26106" type="main" key="La^verni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăvernĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n26106.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place in Campania</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 8, 4</bibl>; id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 12</bibl> (in <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> IV. 2, p. 235</bibl> Orell.).</sense></entryFree>
lavici: <entryFree id="n26107" type="main" key="Lavi_ci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lavīci</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Lavīcum</orth>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lavīcā-nus</orth>, v. Labici.</entryFree>
lavinia: <entryFree id="n26108" type="main" key="La_vi_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lāvīnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n26108.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the daughter of Latinus and wife of Æneas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=144" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 144</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:764" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 764</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:449" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 449</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">570</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lavinium: <entryFree id="n26109" type="main" key="La_vi_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lāvīnĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n26109.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Latium, near the sea-coast, six Roman miles distant from Laurentum, founded by Æneas in honor of his wife Lavinia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Pratica</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=144" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 144</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:728" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 728</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:71" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 71</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n26109.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n26109.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lāvīnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Lavinium, Lavinian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:25" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 25</bibl> (3, 32), 64.—</sense><sense id="n26109.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lāvīnĭenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <cb n="LAVO" /> <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Lavinium, Lavinians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:18" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lavito: <entryFree id="n26110" type="hapax" key="la^vi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăvĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>lavo</etym>, <sense id="n26110.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wash, bathe</hi>: se lacrimis falsis, Pompon. ap. Calp. Pis. ap. Merul. Fragm. Ennii, p. 308 (dub.; v. Com. Fragm. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1321,001:v. 164" default="NO"><author>Pompon.</author> v. 164</bibl> Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
lavo: <entryFree id="n26111" type="main" key="la^vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăvo</orth>, <itype>lāvi, lautum, lăvātum and lōtum</itype> (in class. prose, <sense id="n26111.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> lāvi; <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> always lavātum; <hi rend="ital">perf. part.</hi> lautus; the other forms of the first conj. Also, <hi rend="ital">pres.</hi> lavĕre; <hi rend="ital">second pers.</hi> lavis, ante-class. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> 1, p. 377</bibl>; v. Neue, Formenl. second ed. 2, p. 420), 1 and <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">lu</foreign>- in <foreign lang="greek">lu/qron</foreign>; strengthened in <foreign lang="greek">lou/w, lou=tron</foreign>; cf. <foreign lang="greek">lo/vetron</foreign>; Lat. luo (pol-luo, etc.), diluvium, lutus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to wash, bathe, lave</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26111.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si inquinata erit lavito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 65</bibl></cit>: puerum, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 504, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus lavite,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Titin.</author> ib. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus lava,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:60:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 60, 246</bibl></cit>: cum jam manus pransores lavarent, Veran. ap. Macrob. S. 3, 6, 14.—Mid.: cum soceris generi non lavantur, <hi rend="ital">do not bathe themselves</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bathe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:35:129" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 35, 129</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lavantur in fluminibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur te lautum voluit occidere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lautis manibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:282" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 282</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lotis pedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 11, 62, § 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestimenta lota,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui it lavatum in balineas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 51</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">eo lavatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 62</bibl>;
