<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(venias) vasa lautum, non ad cenam dico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 2, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26111.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisces ego credo, qui usque dum vivunt, lavant, Minus diu lavere, quam haec lavat Phronesium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit> sqq.: <cit><quote lang="la">illa si jam laverit, mihi nuncia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lavanti regi dicitur nuntiatum, hostes adesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26111.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to wet, moisten, bedew</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eas (tabellas) lacrimis lavis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ... neque quicquam captumst piscium, salsi lautique pure domum redimus clanculum,</quote> <trans><tr>soaked</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 1, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:950" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 950</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimis vultum lavere profusis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:680" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 680</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:709" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 709</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. of bloodshed: lavit ater corpora sanguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 221</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lavit improba teter Ora cruor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:727" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 10, 727</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguine largo Colla,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 722</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma cerebro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:153" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his (rivis) nunc illa viridia, nunc haec, interdum simul omnia lavantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 40</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of rivers: flavus quam Tiberis lavat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 3, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 16, 28</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the ocean: quas Oceani refluum mare lavit arenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 267</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n26111.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to wash away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">venias nunc precibus lautum peccatum tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulci Mala vino lavere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 12, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">lautus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n26111.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">washed, bathed, laved</hi> (very rare): nam itast ingenium muliebre; <cit><quote lang="la">bene quom lauta tersa ornata fictast, infectast tamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: in double meaning with C., <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>: lautam vis an nondum lauta quae sit? <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Siccam, at sucidam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 192</bibl> Lorenz ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n26111.6" n="B" level="2"> Hence, transf., <hi rend="ital">neat, elegant, splendid, sumptuous, luxurious</hi>: tute tibi puer es; <cit><quote lang="la">lautus luces cereum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in a fine dress</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil apud hunc lautum, nihil elegans, nihil exquisitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:27:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 27, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lauta supellex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:36:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 36, 165</bibl></cit>: lautum victum et elegantem colere, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 337, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnificum et lautum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 16, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lautiora opera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 15, 26, § 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lauto cenare paratu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:13" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epulae lautiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:6:32" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 6, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lautissima vina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 13, 15, § 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lautissima cena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:257" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 257</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lautum et copiosum patrimonium,</quote> <trans><tr>rich, splendid, noble</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:14:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 14, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in civitate Halaesina tam lauta, tamque nobili,</quote> <trans><tr>wealthy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 32, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valde jam lautus es, qui gravere litteras ad me dare,</quote> <trans><tr>you are now very grand</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines lauti et urbani,</quote> <trans><tr>noble, distinguished</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:6:section=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 6, § 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertis minus lautis servisque nihil defuit: nam lautiores eleganter accepti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:52:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 52, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certumque fit ... cocos tum panem lautioribus coquere solitos,</quote> <trans><tr>for the rich</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 11, 28, § 108</bibl></cit>: orborum lautissimus. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:221" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 221</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26111.7" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rhombos libertis ponere lautus,</quote> <trans><tr>splendid</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:23" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26111.8" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">noble, glorious</hi>, etc.: beneficentiae et liberalitatis est ratio duplex: nam aut opera benigne fit indigentibus, aut pecunia: facilior est haec posterior, locupleti praesertim: sed illa lautior ac splendidior, <hi rend="ital">nobler</hi>, <pb n="1045" /> <cb n="LAXO" /> <hi rend="ital">more glorious</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:15:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 15, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lautum negotium,</quote> <trans><tr>honorable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium hortensiorum lautissima cura asparagis,</quote> <trans><tr>the most diligent, the nicest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 42, § 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lautus habetur,</quote> <trans><tr>a gentleman</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:1" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:67" default="NO">1, 67</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lautē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">neatly, elegantly, splendidly, sumptuously</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26111.9" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">laute exornatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facete, lepide, laute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Chabr. 3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Chabr. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res domesticas lautius tueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lautius accipi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:55" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 55</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n26111.10" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">excellently, beautifully, finely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loquitur laute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militem laute ludificari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munus administrasti tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis existat, qui putet nos lautius fecisse, quam orationis severitas exigat,</quote> <trans><tr>that I have made more use of ornament</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: hodie me ante omnes comicos stultos senes Versaris atque emunxeris lautissime, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 26, 99</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lax: <entryFree id="n26112" type="gloss" key="lax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lax</orth> <etym>cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">le/xris</foreign>; Lat.: licinus, luxus</etym>, <sense id="n26112.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fraud, deception</hi>: lacit decipiendo inducit. Lax etenim fraus est, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=116" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 116</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
laxamentum: <entryFree id="n26113" type="main" key="laxa_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laxāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>laxo</etym>, <sense id="n26113.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an extending, widening</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26113.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ventus laxamentum sibi parat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:18:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventris,</quote> <trans><tr>an evacuating, purging</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26113.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (in concr.), <hi rend="ital">a wide space, room</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">choragia laxamentum habeant, ad chorum parandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 9, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26113.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a relaxation, mitigation, alleviation, respite</hi> (not freq. till after the Aug. per.): <cit><quote lang="la">si quid laxamenti a bello Samnitium esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo laxamento cogitationibus dato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut minus laxamenti daretur iis ad auxilia Hannibali submittenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:39" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 39</bibl>: nactus in navigatione pusillum laxamenti, Trebon. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 16, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare laxamentum legi,</quote> <trans><tr>laxity, indulgence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:33:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 33, 89</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">leges rem surdam, inexorabilem esse ... nihil laxamenti nec veniae habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
laxatio: <entryFree id="n26114" type="main" key="laxa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laxātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26114.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a widening, wide space, width, breadth</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n26114.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">duorum digitorum laxatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 7, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26114.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A relief, mitigation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1:52 al" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 1, 52 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
laxativus: <entryFree id="n26115" type="main" key="laxa_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laxātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26115.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mitigating, assuaging</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cataplasmata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:3:67" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 3, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:17:151" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Acut. 3, 17, 151</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
laxatus: <entryFree id="n26116" type="main" key="laxa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laxātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from laxo.</entryFree>
laxe: <entryFree id="n26117" type="main" key="laxe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laxē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. laxus <sense id="n26117.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
laxitas: <entryFree id="n26118" type="main" key="laxi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laxĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>laxus</etym>, <sense id="n26118.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">width, roominess, spaciousness, extent</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26118.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare but class.), of a house, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:39:139" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 39, 139</bibl>: loci, Sall. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 132, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laxitas appellatur Propontis, angustiae Thracius Bosporus,</quote> <trans><tr>the wide part</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 24, § 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14</bibl></cit> prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">5: spatiosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 43, 68, § 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hae semitae opportunam laxitatem praebent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 18</bibl></cit>: aëris. i. e. <hi rend="ital">a free current of air</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 5</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n26118.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">laxity, languor</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 197</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
laxo: <entryFree id="n26119" type="main" key="laxo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laxo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (rarely <gen>n.</gen>; v. I. B. 2. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>. and II. B. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>. infra) [id.], <sense id="n26119.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stretch out, extend, to make wide</hi> or <hi rend="ital">roomy, to expand</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26119.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">forum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 16, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manipulos,</quote> <trans><tr>to open the ranks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lilium ab angustiis in latitudinem paulatim se laxans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 5, 11, § 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26119.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26119.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To open, undo, unloose</hi> (syn. solvo): <cit><quote lang="la">vincula epistolae laxavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nodos Herculeos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:632" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 632</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi dolor vocem laxaverat,</quote> <trans><tr>had loosened his voice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:4:13" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 42, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">claustra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">claustra portarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:261" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 261</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intestina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 36, 54, § 129</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26119.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To slacken, relax</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laxare arcum,</quote> <trans><tr>to slacken, unbend</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:14:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 14, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excussos rudentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 267</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laxantur corpora rugis,</quote> <trans><tr>become flabby with wrinkles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laxatis habenis invehi jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:9:24" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 9, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:15:3" default="NO">4, 15, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laxatisque vinculis ... ostendit manum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:4:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 14, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se cutis arida laxet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:144" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum ad nervos laxandos utile est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 8, 80, § 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus velut laxatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum,</quote> <trans><tr>to smelt</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 429</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n26119.5" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebris fluctibus compages operis verberatae laxavere,</quote> <trans><tr>were loosened, opened</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 3, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26119.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To lighten, ease</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pharetra graves laxavit umeros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 787" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 787</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26119.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26119.8" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To lighten, relieve, unbend, recreate</hi> (syn.: levo, libero): a contentione disputationis animos curamque<cb n="LEAE" />  laxemus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:61:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 61, 230</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicum animos atque a severitate ad hilaritatem traducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:93:322" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 93, 322</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum ab assiduis laboribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 5</bibl></cit>: ut istis te molestiis laxes, <hi rend="ital">release yourself</hi>, Luc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 14, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26119.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To relax, mitigate, moderate, abate, weaken</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui laxare aliquid laboris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix primos inopina quies laxaverat artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">placida laxarant membra quiete ... nautae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 836</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subtile examen justitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:831" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 831</bibl></cit>: nigrantes tenebras <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 254</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulatim temeritate laxata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longiore dierum spatio laxare dicendi necessitatem,</quote> <trans><tr>to prolong, delay, defer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriae inhaeret fldelius, quod nulla scribendi securitate laxatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:6:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rarescit multo laxatus vulnere miles,</quote> <trans><tr>weakened</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:422" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 422</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">To lay open, disclose, reveal</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">fata latentia laxa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 508</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26119.10" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To reduce the price of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">annonam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:34:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 34, 12</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">neutr., to lessen, fall</hi> in price: <cit><quote lang="la">annona laxaverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 20</bibl></cit>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">laxātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., spread out, separated, extended, wide</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26119.11" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">custodiae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>separated, withdrawn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">custodia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membrana laxatior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 3, § 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laxati ordines (aciei),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:364" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 364</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpore laxati,</quote> <trans><tr>released from the body</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n26119.12" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidinum vinculis laxati,</quote> <trans><tr>released, freed, free</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laxatus curis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:19:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 19, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugna,</quote> <trans><tr>a battle broken off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>clear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:550" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 550</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
laxus: <entryFree id="n26120" type="main" key="laxus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laxus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cf. languidus, languor, lactes</etym>, <sense id="n26120.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wide, loose, open; spacious, roomy;</hi> opp. adstrictus (not freq. till after the Aug. per.). </sense><sense id="n26120.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: laxius agmen, Sall. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 235, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">casses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:18" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 6, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:78" default="NO">2, 3, 78</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in pede calceus haeret,</quote> <trans><tr>wide, loose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuces Ferre sinu laxo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qua satis laxo spatio equi permitti possent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 5</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">spatium,</quote> <trans><tr>wide, roomy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 88" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 88 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">laxior domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:81" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">janua,</quote> <trans><tr>open</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 8, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">compages,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:21" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 13</bibl></cit> (v. under II.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 4, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui jam contento, jam laxo fune laborat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcus,</quote> <trans><tr>slackened, unbent, unstrung</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:874" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 874</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laxo meditantur arcu cedere campis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opes,</quote> <trans><tr>large, great</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:30:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 30, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26120.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">laxissimas habenas habere amicitiae,</quote> <trans><tr>very wide, loose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 13, 45</bibl></cit>: si bellum cum eo hoste haberemus, in quo neglegentiae laxior locus esset, <hi rend="ital">greater latitude</hi> or <hi rend="ital">scope</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 8</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">laxius imperium,</quote> <trans><tr>less strict, more indulgent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annona,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>reduced, cheap</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <trans><tr>relaxed, disordered from drinking</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:58" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <trans><tr>pronounced broad</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:20:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 20, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laxioribus verbis dicere aliquid,</quote> <trans><tr>prolix, diffuse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 16, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—Of time: <cit><quote lang="la">diem statuo satis laxam,</quote> <trans><tr>sufficiently distant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus sibi et quidem laxius postulavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 9 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">laxē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">widely, spaciously, loosely</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26120.3" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis sideris laxe grassantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 97, 99, § 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">distans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 4, 7, § 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum laxius dilatatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 3, 19, § 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mercurii stella laxissime vagatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 16, 13, § 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medio suspendit vincula ponto, Et laxe fluitare sinit,</quote> <trans><tr>loosely, freely</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:450" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 450</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus vincire,</quote> <trans><tr>loosely</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 10, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26120.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">laxius proferre diem,</quote> <trans><tr>to put farther off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 14, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">volo laxius (sc. rem curari),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 20, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de munere pastorum alii angustius, alii laxius constituere solent,</quote> <trans><tr>a greater number, more</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:10:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hostico laxius rapto suetis vivere artiores in pace res erant,</quote> <trans><tr>more unrestrictedly, more freely</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:24:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 24, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romanos remoto metu laxius licentiusque futuros,</quote> <trans><tr>be more relaxed in discipline, more negligent, disorderly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lea: <entryFree id="n26121" type="main" key="le^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>leo</etym>, <sense id="n26121.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lioness</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> for leaena): panthera et lea, Varr. ap. Philarg. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 63</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1318" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1318</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus et ora leae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:648" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 648</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hirsutae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:176" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 176</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 255</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saeva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 102</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
leaena: <entryFree id="n26122" type="greek" key="le^aena1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕaena</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">le/aina</foreign>, <sense id="n26122.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lioness</hi>: statuerunt aeream leaenam, Cic. ap. Philarg. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 16, 17, § 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:7:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:90" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2</bibl>, <cb n="LECT" /> 63; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 245</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 408</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 97</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">514</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 615</bibl>; 13, 547; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 154</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26123" type="main" key="Le^aena2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĕaena</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*le/aina</foreign>, <sense id="n26123.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an heroic courtesan of Athens, in the time of Harmodius and Aristogīton</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 23, 23, § 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:72" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 8, 19, § 72</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leander: <entryFree id="n26124" type="main" key="Le_ander"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lēander</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Lēandrus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Spect. 25" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Spect. 25</bibl>; <case>voc.</case> Leandre, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 19, 1 al.</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lei/andros</foreign>, <sense id="n26124.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a young man of Abydos, who, in order to visit Hero in Sestos, swam nightly across the Hellespont, until he was drowned in a storm</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 18</bibl> and 19; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:10:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 10, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:181" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 181</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n26124.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n26124.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lēandrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Leander, Leandrian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">natatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 1 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n26124.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lēandrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Leander, Leandrian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Leandrius Hellespontus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:622" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 622</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
learchus: <entryFree id="n26125" type="main" key="Le^archus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĕarchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*le/arxos</foreign>, <sense id="n26125.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the son of Athamas and Ino, whom Athamas, in a fit of madness, killed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:515" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 515</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:479" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 479</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 1, 2</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n26125.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĕar-chēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Learchus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:491" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 491</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lebadia: <entryFree id="n26126" type="main" key="Le^ba^di^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĕbădĭa</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĕbădēa</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:345" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 345</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lebadei/a, *lebadi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n26126.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Bœotian city near Mount Helicon, and above which was situated the cave of Trophonius, with a temple</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Livadhia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:34:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 34, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:27:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 27, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lebedus: <entryFree id="n26127" type="main" key="Le^be^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĕbĕdus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-dos</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*le/bedos</foreign>, <sense id="n26127.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city on the coast of Ionia, north of Colophon; where every year great theatrical games were celebrated in honor of Bacchus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 6 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:17:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 17, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 116</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leber: <entryFree id="n26128" type="gloss" key="leber"><orth extent="full" lang="la">leber</orth> <itype>for liber</itype>, v. 1. liber <sense id="n26128.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
lebes: <entryFree id="n26129" type="main" key="le^bes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕbes</orth>, <itype>ētis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">le/bhs</foreign>, among the Greeks, <sense id="n26129.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a copper basin, kettle, caldron</hi>, for cooking, frequently given as an honorary reward or prize: <cit><quote lang="la">tertia dona facit geminos ex aere lebetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 266</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dodonaei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 466</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 3, 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26129.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A handbasin</hi> for washing, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 243</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26129.2" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A bronze vessel</hi> in which flesh was boiled, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 1</bibl> Sam. 2, 14 al.: <cit><quote lang="la">lebetes aëneae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 22, 8, 11</bibl></cit>.—For ashes: <cit><quote lang="la">lebetes ad suscipiendos cineres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 27, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lebynthos: <entryFree id="n26130" type="main" key="Le^bynthos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĕbynthos</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĕbynthus, Lĕbin-thos</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*le/binqos</foreign>, <sense id="n26130.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the Sporadic Isles</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Lenitha</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 222</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lechaeum: <entryFree id="n26131" type="main" key="Le^chaeum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĕchaeum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĕchaeae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*le/xaion</foreign>, <sense id="n26131.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the port of Corinth, on the Corinthian Gulf</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:23:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 23, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:2:34" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 2, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:20" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 20</bibl> (4, 21), 19; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:381" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 381</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Corinthiacus hinc, illinc Saronicus appellatur sinus: Lechaeae hinc, Cenchreae illinc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 4, 5, § 12</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n26131.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĕ-chaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Lechæum, Lechæan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 227</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lectarius: <entryFree id="n26132" type="gloss" key="lecta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lectārĭus</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">klinopoio/s</foreign> (<sense id="n26132.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a couch-maker</hi>), Gloss. Philox.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">FABER LECTARIVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4183</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lecte: <entryFree id="n26133" type="main" key="lecte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lectē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 2. lego, <sense id="n26133.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
lectica: <entryFree id="n26134" type="main" key="lecti_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lectīca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n26134.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a litter, sedan</hi>, used at first only on journeys, but afterwards also, for the sake of convenience, in the city: <cit><quote lang="la">lecticā octophoro ferebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:11:section=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 11, § 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lecticae usum alicui adimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inditus lecticae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lecticae imponere aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lecticā gestare aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 214</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lecticae gestamine uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: in eadem illa lecticā qua ipse delatus eram, eum referre, etc., Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 12, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectica introferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectica formosis imposita calonibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 110:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 110, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comparare homines ad lecticam,</quote> <trans><tr>litterbearers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 10, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facit somnum clausā lectica fenestrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:242" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 242</bibl></cit>.—Collect.: <cit><quote lang="la">densissima centum Quadrantes lectica petit,</quote> <trans><tr>a throng of litters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:121" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 121</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n26134.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">arboris,</quote> <trans><tr>that part of a tree from which the branches spring</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 14, 22, § 99</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lecticariola: <entryFree id="n26135" type="hapax" key="lecti_ca_ri^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lectīcārĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>lecticarius</etym>, <sense id="n26135.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chairman's mistress</hi>, a comically formed term of reproach, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:58:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 58, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lecticarius: <entryFree id="n26136" type="main" key="lecti_ca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lectīcārĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>lectica</etym>, <sense id="n26136.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a litterbearer, sedan-bearer, chairman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:46:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 46, 134</bibl>; Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 12, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lecticarii cum asseribus in auxilium accucurrerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>with their poles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:58" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter urbana ministeria continentur ... et lecticarii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 6, 72</bibl></cit>.—The chairmen formed a guild or corporation: EX <pb n="1046" /> <cb n="LECT" /> CORPORE LECTICARIORVM CAESARIS, Inscr. ap. Grut. 599, 11: <cit><quote lang="la">DECVRIO LECTICARIORVM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 600, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2871</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6323</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lecticula: <entryFree id="n26137" type="main" key="lecti_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lectīcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>lectica</etym>, <sense id="n26137.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small litter</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sedan</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26137.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">lecticulā in curiam esse delatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:26:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 26, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scipio lecticulā in aciem illatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 42</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n26137.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n26137.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A bier</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">elatus est in lecticula sine ulla pompa funebri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 22, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26137.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A couch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">settee</hi>, on which one lay while reading or writing: <cit><quote lang="la">lucubratoria lecticula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:78" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 78</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26137.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of <hi rend="ital">a hen's nest</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 232</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lectio: <entryFree id="n26138" type="main" key="lecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>lego</etym>. <sense id="n26138.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A gathering, collecting</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26138.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">lectio lapidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">florum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 173</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n26138.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a picking out, selecting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 6, 16</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n26138.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A reading, perusal; a reading out, reading aloud</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26138.4" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26138.5" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">delectabatur lectione librorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectio sine ulla delectatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non cruda, sed multa iteratione mollita et velut confecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">continua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 34</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1</bibl>, cap. 8 and 10, cap. 1 <hi rend="ital">passim</hi>.—</sense><sense id="n26138.6" n="2" level="3"> In partic.: lectio senatūs, <hi rend="ital">a reading off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">calling over</hi> the names of the senators; <cit><quote lang="la">this was done by the censor, who at the same time struck the unworthy ones from the list: infamis atque invidiosa senatus lectio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:11" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 35</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26138.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (abstr. pro contr.), <hi rend="ital">that which is read, reading, text</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">lectio tamen docet, eo tempore solitos, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec sunt quae lectio pontificalis habet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 13, 11</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris lectiones,</quote> <trans><tr>passages of the laws</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 6, 61, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi lectio aliqua falsitate notata est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 1, 20, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pervulgati juris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">datā lectione quae non sit intellectu difficilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:5:163" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 5, 163</bibl></cit>: quia Moyses prius hoc statuit, sicut lectio manifestat, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 7, 1 prooem.</sense></entryFree>
lectisterniator: <entryFree id="n26139" type="hapax" key="lectisterni^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lectisternĭātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>lectisternium</etym>, <sense id="n26139.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who arranged the couches and placed the cushions on them for reclining on at table</hi>: propera, abi intro; <cit><quote lang="la">tu esto lectisterniator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lectis sternundis studuimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 5, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lectisternium: <entryFree id="n26140" type="main" key="lectisterni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lectisternĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>2. lectus-sterno</etym>, <sense id="n26140.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a feast of the gods</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26140.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, an offering in which the images of the gods, lying on pillows, were placed in the streets, and food of all kinds set before them; <cit><quote lang="la">these banquets were prepared by the Epulones, and consumed by them,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 13, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 2, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 25</bibl>; 21, 62; 22, 1; 10 et saep.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lecti sternebantur in honorem deorum, unde hoc sacrum, vel potius sacrilegium nomen accepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:C. D. 3:17:2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> C. D. 3, 17, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. also Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=351" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 351</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n26140.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in the Christian age, <hi rend="ital">a feast held in memory of a deceased person</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">at the consecration of a chapel dedicated to him, a feast of the dead</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 753, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lectito: <entryFree id="n26141" type="main" key="lecti^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lectĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>2. lego</etym>. <sense id="n26141.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To gather</hi> or <hi rend="ital">collect eagerly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">often</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">conchulas et calculos in litore lectitasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:8:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 183</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n26141.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To read often, with eagerness</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">with attention</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Pyrrhi te video libros lectitasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 25, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctores quos nunc lectito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Platonem studiose,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:31:121" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 31, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libros non legendos sed lectitandos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libros conquisitos lectitatosque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationes,</quote> <trans><tr>to read aloud</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 17, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lectiuncula: <entryFree id="n26142" type="hapax" key="lecti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lectĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>lectio</etym>, <sense id="n26142.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a short</hi> or <hi rend="ital">light reading</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">matutina tempora lectiunculis consumpseris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lecto: <entryFree id="n26143" type="main" key="lecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lecto</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <sense id="n26143.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq.</hi> [2. lego], = lectito, Vet. Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 122</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 142</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
lecton: <entryFree id="n26144" type="main" key="Lecton"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lecton</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Lectum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*le/kton</foreign>, <sense id="n26144.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a promontory on the coast of Troy</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">C. Baba</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 32, § 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:62" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 17, 29, § 62</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lector: <entryFree id="n26145" type="main" key="lector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lector</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>2. lego</etym>, <sense id="n26145.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who reads</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26145.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26145.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a reader</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum enim Brutus duos lectores excitasset, et alteri orationem legendam dedisset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:55:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 55, 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est aptius ad delectationem lectoris, quam fortunae vicissitudines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se lectori credere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 214</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otiosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: adsiduo ruptae lectore columnae, Juv. <cb n="LEDA" /> 1, 13.—</sense><sense id="n26145.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a slave who read aloud to his master</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum aliquem constituere lectorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectorem inducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 17, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 1:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 15, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26145.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an officer in the Christian Church</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque hodie diaconus, qui cras lector,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Haeretic. 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lectrix: <entryFree id="n26146" type="gloss" key="lectrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lectrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>lector</etym>, <sense id="n26146.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female reader</hi>, Inscr. ap. Fabr. p. 311, n. 347; cf. Cledon. p. 1893 P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 12, 159</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lectualis: <entryFree id="n26147" type="hapax" key="lectu^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lectŭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. lectus</etym>, <sense id="n26147.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the bed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbus,</quote> <trans><tr>which confines one to his bed</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 23</bibl></cit> dub. (al. letalis).</sense></entryFree>
lectuarius: <entryFree id="n26148" type="main" key="lectu^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lectŭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26148.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the bed, bed-</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">lectuaria (lecticaria) sindon,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 537, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lectulus: <entryFree id="n26149" type="main" key="lectu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lectŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26149.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cosey couch, a bed</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26149.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui sese illa ipsa nocte me in meo lectulo interfecturos pollicerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophi in suis lectulis plerumque moriuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:30:97" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 30, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a ducenda uxore sic abhorret, ut quicquam libero lectulo neget esse jucundius,</quote> <trans><tr>single</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testis mihi lectulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:77" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 77</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26149.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n26149.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A small couch for reclining on at meals, an eatingcouch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuite hic lectulos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectuli Puniciani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:36:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 36, 75</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n26149.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A funeral-bed, bed of state</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26149.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A reading-couch, lounge, settee, sofa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:1:38" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 1, 38</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26149.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A bridal-bed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:38:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 38, 7</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">in full, lectulus matrimonialis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 1:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 1, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lecturio: <entryFree id="n26150" type="main" key="lectu^ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lectŭrĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <sense id="n26150.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. desid. a.</hi> [2. lego], <hi rend="ital">to desire to read, be inclined to read</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lectus: <entryFree id="n26151" type="main" key="lectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from 2. lego.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26152" type="main" key="lectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lectus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<case>nom.</case> <orth extent="full" lang="la">lectum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:52:section=9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 52, § 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:19:section=8" default="NO">34, 2, 19, § 8</bibl>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">lectus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 15</bibl>; al. lecti; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:72" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 72</bibl> Haas; Cornif. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 711</bibl> P.) [Gr. <foreign lang="greek">le/xos, a)/loxos, lo/xos, lo/xmh</foreign>; Lat. lectica; cf. Germ. Lager], <sense id="n26152.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a couch, bed</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26152.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">meum quidem te lectum certe occupare non sinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dapsilis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">standumst in lecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lecti loris subtenti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in lecto esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lecto teneri,</quote> <trans><tr>to be confined to one's bed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:7:section=16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 7, § 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surgere lecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:18" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 18</bibl></cit> (3, 15), 31: <cit><quote lang="la">descendere lecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:19" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 19</bibl></cit> (al. derepere): <cit><quote lang="la">lectus Proculā minor,</quote> <trans><tr>too short for</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:203" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes lecti, in quo cubat Dialis, luto tenui circumlitos esse oportet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:15:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 15, 14</bibl></cit> sqq.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectos eburatos, auratos (advexit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26152.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n26152.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A bridal bed</hi>: lectus genialis, <hi rend="ital">the nuptial-bed</hi>, which, after the marriage, was called adversus (because it stood opposite the door): <cit><quote lang="la">genialis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 11, 85: <cit><quote lang="la">jugalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:496" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 496</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aucupor in lecto mendaces caelibe somnos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 13, 107</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26152.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A couch for reclining on at meals, a dining-</hi> or <hi rend="ital">eating-couch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:74:section=183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 74, § 183</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lecto recumbere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in imo lecto residere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:64" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26152.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A couch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">settee on which it was customary to read or write, a reading-couch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 72:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 72, 2</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n26152.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A funeral bed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">couch, a bier</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flebis et arsuro positum me, Delia, lecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:61" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lecto funebri aptatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus ipsum impositum lecto erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26153" type="main" key="lectus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lectus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>2. lego</etym>, <sense id="n26153.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reading</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 1221</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n26153.1" n="II" level="1"> = 2. lectus, q. v.</sense></entryFree>
lecythinus: <entryFree id="n26154" type="main" key="le_cy^thi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēcythĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym><foreign lang="greek">lh/kuqos</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n26154.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to an oil-flask</hi>: oleum lecythinum, <hi rend="ital">oil from the flask</hi> (al. legitimo or lecythi), <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lecythus: <entryFree id="n26155" type="main" key="le_cy^thus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēcythus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lh/kuqos</foreign>, <sense id="n26155.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a flask, cruise</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:17:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 17, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leda: <entryFree id="n26156" type="main" key="Le_da1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lēda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lēdē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lh/da</foreign>, <sense id="n26156.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the daughter of Thestius, and wife of Tyndarus; she bore by Jupiter, who visited her in the form of a swan, two eggs, from one of which came Pollux and Helen, and from the other Castor and Clytemnestra</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 6, 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 77" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueri Ledae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Castor and Pollux</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 25</bibl></cit>.—She was deified after her death, under the name of Nemesis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: chironomon Ledam saltare, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in the part of Leda in a pantomime</hi>,<cb n="LEGA" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:63" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 63</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n26156.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lēdaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Leda, Ledæan</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26156.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ledaei dei,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Castor and Pollux</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:706" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 706</bibl></cit>; also, <cit><quote lang="la">Lacones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:37:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 37, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Helena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:364" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 364</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hermione (as granddaughter of Leda),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 328</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ovum,</quote> <trans><tr>a swan's egg</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:33:21" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 33, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">olores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:54:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 54, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Timavus, because Castor, on the return of the Argonauts, let his horse Cyllarus drink of it,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:25:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 25, 5</bibl></cit>;
