cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Cyllarus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:1:54" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">astrum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Castor and Pollux</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:21:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 21, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26156.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf. </sense><sense id="n26156.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Spartan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phalantum,</quote> <trans><tr>Tarentum, founded by the Spartan Phalantus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:28:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 28, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gurges,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the Eurotas</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:6:45" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 6, 45</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n26156.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Amyclæan</hi> (because Castor and Pollux were born at Amyclæ): <cit><quote lang="la">Xanthippus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:358" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 358</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26157" type="main" key="le_da2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">lēdon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">lēdănum</orth>, v. lada.</entryFree>
ledas: <entryFree id="n26158" type="main" key="Le_da_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lēdās</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26158.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a man</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:63" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 63</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ledus: <entryFree id="n26159" type="main" key="Le_du^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lēdŭs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26159.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in</hi> Gallia Narbonensis, now <hi rend="ital">Lez</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Pan. 813</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
legalis: <entryFree id="n26160" type="main" key="le_ga_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēgālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lex</etym>, <sense id="n26160.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the law, legal</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">genus quaestionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:5:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 5, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:86 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 86 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">status,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tractatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: vita, <hi rend="ital">according to the</hi> (divine) <hi rend="ital">law, pious</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 25</bibl>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lēgālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">according to law, legally</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversarium provocare legaliter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Ep. 4, 37</bibl></cit>: de homicidiis Moyses legaliter dicit, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in laying down the law</hi>, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 1, 5 prooem.</sense></entryFree>
legarium: <entryFree id="n26161" type="hapax" key="le^ga_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕgārĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>2. lego</etym>, <sense id="n26161.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pulse, legumes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:32" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
legatarius: <entryFree id="n26162" type="main" key="le_ga_ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēgātārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>legatum</etym>, <sense id="n26162.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">enjoined by a last will</hi> or <hi rend="ital">testament</hi> (postclass.). </sense><sense id="n26162.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">editiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 6</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n26162.2" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n26162.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lēgātārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one to whom something is left by will, a legatee</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:3:14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 3, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:195" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 195</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">antequam legatarius admittat legatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:ib. 2:200" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 200</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26162.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lēgātārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a female legatee</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:11:43" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 11, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:4:2" default="NO">33, 4, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
legaticius: <entryFree id="n26163" type="main" key="le_ga_ti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēgātīcĭus</orth>, v. legativus.</entryFree>
legatio: <entryFree id="n26164" type="main" key="le_ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. lego</etym>, <sense id="n26164.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the sending of an ambassador;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">the office of an ambassador, an embassy, legation</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26164.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26164.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum legatione in provinciam esset profectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:5:section=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 5, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legationem obire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is sibi legationem ad civitates suscepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legationis officium conficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in legationem proficisci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in legatione esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:50" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legatio male gesta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:4:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munus legationis recusare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 33</bibl></cit>: legationem renuntiare, <hi rend="ital">to make a report</hi> or <hi rend="ital">give an account of one's embassy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 9, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:32" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 32</bibl>; 36, 35; 39, 33; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:9:20 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 9, 20 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. renuntio, I. B.: legationem ementiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:Or. 7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Opt. Gen. Or. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Treveris Germanos crebris legationibus sollicitari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per legationes petere foedus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26164.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n26164.4" n="1" level="3"> Libera legatio, <hi rend="ital">a free legation</hi>, i. e. permission granted to a senator to visit one or more provinces on his private affairs in the character of an ambassador, but without performing the duties of one (such an embassy was called <hi rend="ital">free</hi>, because while it lasted the holder of it was at liberty to come to the city of Rome and leave it again without resigning his office): <cit><quote lang="la">negotiorum suorum causa legatus est in Africam legatione libera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habent opinor liberae legationes definitum tempus lege Julia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 11</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">called simply legatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:8:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 8, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui libera legatione abest, non videtur rei publicae causa abesse: hic enim non publici causa, sed sui abest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:7:14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 7, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26164.5" n="2" level="3"> Legatio votiva, <hi rend="ital">a free embassy assumed for the purpose</hi> (often a mere pretext) <hi rend="ital">of paying a vow in a province</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26164.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The charge of a</hi> legatus Augusti (v. legatus, B. 2.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 9</bibl>; v. Orell. ad h. l.— </sense><sense id="n26164.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the persons attached to an embassy, an embassy, legation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">communem legationem ad Crassum mittunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus legationis Divico princeps fuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas legationes Caesar ad se reverti jussit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab Eumene legatio de victoria gratulatum venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 13</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1047" /> <cb n="LEGI" /></sense></entryFree>
legativus: <entryFree id="n26165" type="main" key="le_ga_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēgātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. lego</etym>. <sense id="n26165.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to an embassy</hi> (post-class.): viaticum, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">lēgātīvum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an ambassador's expenses</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viaticum, quod legativum dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:4:18:section=12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 4, 18, § 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his, qui non gratuitam legationem susceperunt, legativum ex forma restituitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:7:2:section=3" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 50, 7, 2, § 3</bibl></cit> (al. legaticium).—</sense><sense id="n26165.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Left by a last will</hi> or <hi rend="ital">testament</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3817</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
legator: <entryFree id="n26166" type="hapax" key="le_ga_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēgātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26166.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who leaves something by will, a testator</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntas legatoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
legatorius: <entryFree id="n26167" type="main" key="le_ga_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēgātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>legatus</etym>, <sense id="n26167.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a deputy</hi>: provincia, <hi rend="ital">one given to a senator as deputy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lieutenant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 9, 1</bibl> B. and K. (dub.; Orell. locatoria).</sense></entryFree>
legatum: <entryFree id="n26168" type="main" key="le_ga_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēgātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. 1. lego <sense id="n26168.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> 2.</sense></entryFree>
legatus: <entryFree id="n26169" type="main" key="le_ga_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēgātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. 1. lego <sense id="n26169.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> 1.</sense></entryFree>
legibilis: <entryFree id="n26170" type="main" key="le^gi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕgĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. lego</etym>, <sense id="n26170.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be read, legible</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">si legibilia sunt inconsulto deleta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:4:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
legicrepa: <entryFree id="n26171" type="gloss" key="le_gi^cre^pa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēgĭcrĕpa</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">nomodi/fas</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
legifer: <entryFree id="n26172" type="main" key="le_gi^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēgĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lex-fero</etym>, <sense id="n26172.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lawgiving</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n26172.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Minos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:10:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 10, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legifera Ceres (as the foundress of the social life of mankind),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 58</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n26172.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lēgĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a law-giver</hi>, applied to Moses, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 17, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 3, 363; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:33:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 33, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
legio: <entryFree id="n26173" type="main" key="le^gi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕgĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. lego</etym> (prop., a selecting, choosing; hence), transf., <sense id="n26173.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a body of soldiers</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legio, quod leguntur milites in delectu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=87" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 87</bibl></cit> Müll. </sense><sense id="n26173.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a Roman legion</hi>. It consisted of 10 cohorts of foot-soldiers and 300 cavalry, making together between 4200 and 6000 men. As a general rule, the legion was composed of Roman citizens; it was only on the most pressing occasions that slaves were taken into it. The standard was a silver eagle. The legions were usually designated by numerals, according to the order in which they were levied; <cit><quote lang="la">though sometimes they were named after the emperor who raised them, or after their leader, after a deity, after some exploit performed by them, etc.: cum legionibus secunda ac tertia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undevicesima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicesima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Claudiana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galbiana,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Martia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjutrix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapax,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in legione sunt centuriae sexaginta, manipuli triginta, cohortes decem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:4:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 4, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. Inscr. Orell. Index rerum, s. v. legio.—</sense><sense id="n26173.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26173.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, of the troops of other nations, <hi rend="ital">legions, soldiers</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bruttiae Lucanaeque legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 32</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of the troops of the Samnites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 17</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the Gauls,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 14</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the Carthaginians,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Teleboae ex oppido Legiones educunt suas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quorum (i. e. Thebanorum) sulcis legiones dentibus anguis nascuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:241" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 241</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26173.4" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">an army, a large body of troops</hi>: legio rediit, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 385, 17</bibl> (Ann. v. 535 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">quia cotidie ipse ad me ab legione epistolas mittebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">83</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 2, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tu ad legionem bellator cluis, at ego in culina clueo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera dum legio campis instructa tenetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:368" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 368</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de colle videri poterat legio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 605</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">10, 120: horruit Argoae legio ratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:573" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 573</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26173.5" n="C" level="2"> Of a large body of men: <cit><quote lang="la">idem istuc aliis adscriptivis fieri ad legionem solet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">legio mihi nomen est, quod multi sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 5, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 8, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">duodecim legiones angelorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:26:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 26, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26173.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi nunc uterque contra legiones parat,</quote> <trans><tr>his troops, forces, expedients</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 50</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
legionarius: <entryFree id="n26174" type="main" key="le^gi^o_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕgĭōnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>legio</etym>, <sense id="n26174.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a legion, legionary</hi>: miles, Asin. Poll. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:32:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 32, 5</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">legionarii milites legionis decimae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
legirupa: <entryFree id="n26175" type="main" key="le_gi^ru^pa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēgĭrŭpa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>lex-rumpo</etym>, <sense id="n26175.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lawbreaker</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">perjure, legirupa, pernicies adolescentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 130</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 2, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legirupam damnare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 2, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 239</bibl>; cf. the foll. art.</sense></entryFree>
legirupio: <entryFree id="n26176" type="hapax" key="le_gi^ru^pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēgĭrŭpĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26176.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a law-breaker</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 4</bibl>. <cb n="LEGO" /></sense></entryFree>
legisdoctor: <entryFree id="n26177" type="main" key="le_gisdoctor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēgis-doctor</orth> (also written separately), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26177.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a doctor</hi> or <hi rend="ital">teacher of the law</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 5, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
legislatio: <entryFree id="n26178" type="main" key="le_gisla_tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēgislātio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>lex-latum, <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> of fero</etym>, <sense id="n26178.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the giving of the law</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 9, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
legislator: <entryFree id="n26179" type="main" key="le_gisla_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēgis-lātor</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">lēgum-lātor</orth> (in class. authors usu. written separately; v. lator), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26179.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a law-giver, legislator</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">noster legumlator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:8:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 8, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 329" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Decl. 329</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:334" default="NO">334</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legislator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 5</bibl></cit>, n. 3 <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non satis in ea re legislatorem voluntatem suam verbis expressisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:76 al" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 76 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
legisperitus: <entryFree id="n26180" type="main" key="le_gispe^ri_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēgis-pĕrītus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26180.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one learned in the law, a lawyer</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 7, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
legitime: <entryFree id="n26181" type="main" key="le_gi^ti^me_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēgĭtĭmē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. legitimus <sense id="n26181.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
legitimus: <entryFree id="n26182" type="main" key="le_gi^ti^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēgĭtĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lex; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:8:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 8, 36</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n26182.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fixed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">appointed by law, according to law, lawful, legal, legitimate</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26182.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26182.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies is erat legitimus comitiis habendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:52:section=128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 52, § 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legitimum imperium habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:30:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 30, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scriptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:43:125" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 43, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">controversiae legitimae et civiles,</quote> <trans><tr>which come under and are settled by the laws</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:34:120" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 34, 120</bibl></cit>: justus et legitimus hostis, <hi rend="ital">a lawful adversary</hi>, as distinguished from pirates and other outlaws, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:29:109" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 29, 109</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas legitima ad petendam aedilitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 2</bibl></cit>: horae, <hi rend="ital">allowed by law</hi> (for transacting any business), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:9:section=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 9, § 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">impedimentum,</quote> <trans><tr>a legal impediment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen,</quote> <trans><tr>laid down in the laws</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:20:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 20, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filius (opp. nothus),</quote> <trans><tr>legitimate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:72" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:16" default="NO">5, 14, 16</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 6, 4, 3: matrimonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:2" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 6, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:437" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 437</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legitimis pactam junctamque tabellis amare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:200" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 200</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26182.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lēgĭtĭma</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">usages prescribed by law, precepts</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">legitimis quibusdam confectis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,019:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Phoc. 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">custodite legitima mea,</quote> <trans><tr>precepts, statutes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:18:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 18, 26</bibl></cit>; also in <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">legitimum sempiternum erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:28:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Exod. 28, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26182.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen. </sense><sense id="n26182.5" n="A" level="2"> l. q. legalis, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the law, legal</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">quaestiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:72" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:13" default="NO">7, 3, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:1:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scientia, Just. Inst. prooem. § 4: actio injuriarum, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 2, 5, 5: judicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:103 sq" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 103 sq.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n26182.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Right, just, proper, appropriate</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">numerus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:22:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 22, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in omnibus meis epistolis, legitima quaedam est accessio commendationis tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa oratorum propria et quasi legitima tractavit, ut delectaret, ut moveret, ut augeret, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:21:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 21, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëma facere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insania,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 31, 105, § 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:527" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 527</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partus,</quote> <trans><tr>right, regular</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 43, 64, § 168</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">spectavit studiosissime pugiles, non legitimos et ordinarios modo, sed et catervarios, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 22, 38, § 80</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>: legitimum est, with a <hi rend="ital">subject-clause, it is right, proper, suitable</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">fistulas denum pedum longitudinis esse, legitimum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 6, 31, § 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:64" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 3, 20, § 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">seruntur lactucae anno toto: legitimum tamen, a bruma semen jacere,</quote> <trans><tr>but the proper way is</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 8, 39, § 130</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lēgĭtĭmē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n26182.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">According to law, lawfully, legally, legitimately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">is qui legitime procurator dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:20:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 20, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juste et legitime imperanti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:4:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non nisi legitime vult nubere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:338" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 338</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26182.8" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">duly, properly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">faex legitime cocta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 2, 31, § 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legitime fixis tabellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:100" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 100</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
legito: <entryFree id="n26183" type="gloss" key="le^gi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕgĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n26183.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. a., to read often</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 825</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
legiuncula: <entryFree id="n26184" type="hapax" key="le^gi^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕgĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>legio</etym>, <sense id="n26184.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small legion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:49:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 49, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lego: <entryFree id="n26185" type="main" key="le_go1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum</itype> (archaic <sense id="n26185.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> legassit for legaverit, Fragm. XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:50:148" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 50, 148</bibl>), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>lex; and therefore qs. lege creare</etym>, a publicist's and jurid. t. t. </sense><sense id="n26185.1" n="I" level="1"> A publicist's t. t. </sense><sense id="n26185.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To send with a commission</hi> or <hi rend="ital">charge, to send on an embassy, send as ambassador; to depute, despatch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne hoc quidem senatui relinquebas, ut legati ex ejus ordinis auctoritate legarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:15:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 15, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem honestum ac nobilem legarunt ad Apronium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:48:section=114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 48, § 114</bibl></cit>: eos privatae <cb n="LEGO" /> rei causa legari, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">juste pieque legatus venio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tres adulescentes in Africam legantur, qui reges adeant, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 21, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos Athenienses Romam ad senatum legaverant impetratum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:14:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 14, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26185.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to the commission itself (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quae verba legaverint Rhodii ad hostium ducem,</quote> <trans><tr>what they told him through their deputies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:31" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 31</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n26185.4" n="b" level="4"> Beyond the official sphere: <cit><quote lang="la">quin potius, quod legatum est tibi negotium, Id curas?</quote> <trans><tr>committed, intrusted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 1, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26185.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To appoint</hi> or <hi rend="ital">choose as deputy</hi> (as the official assistant, lieutenant, of a general or governor): <cit><quote lang="la">eum (Messium) Caesari legarat Appius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 15, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego me a Pompeio legari ita sum passus, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istum legatum iri non arbitror,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne legaretur Gabinius Pompeio expetenti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 19, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dolabella me sibi legavit,</quote> <trans><tr>chose me for his lieutenant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Calpurnius parato exercitu legat sibi homines nobiles, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26185.6" n="II" level="1"> A jurid. t. t.: aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to appoint by a last will</hi> or <hi rend="ital">testament, to leave</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bequeath as a legacy</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Numitori, qui stirpis maximus erat, regnum vetustum Silviae gentis legat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>: legavit quidam uxori mundum omne penumque, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:1:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">usumfructum omnium bonorum Caesenniae legat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fabiae pecunia legata est a viro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:3:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui argentum omne legatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:62" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in argento legato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26185.7" n="B" level="2"> Aliquid alicui ab aliquo, <hi rend="ital">to leave one a legacy to be paid by the principal heir</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxori testamento legat grandem pecuniam a filio, si qui natus esset: ab secundo herede nihil legat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 12, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si paterfamilias uxori ancillarum usum fructum legavit a filio, neque a secundo herede legavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:4:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 4, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:9:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 9, 5</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n26185.8" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">lēgātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n26185.9" n="A" level="2"> (Acc. to lego, I. A.) <hi rend="ital">An ambassador, legate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:15:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 15, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legatos mittere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 12, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad senatum legatos de aliqua re mittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:37:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 37, 155</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">missi magnis de rebus uterque Legati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legatos mittere ad indicendum bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:527" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 527</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26185.10" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to lego, I. B.). </sense><sense id="n26185.11" n="a" level="4"> An official assistant given to a general or the governor of a province, <hi rend="ital">a deputy, lieutenant, lieutenant-general</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos legatos tute tibi legasti?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 14, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui M. Aemilio legati fuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:36:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 36, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quintus frater meus legatus est Caesaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:20:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 20, 79</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Murena summo imperatori legatus L. Lucullo fuit, qua in legatione duxit exercitum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 9, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque se ei legatum defuturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 7, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:5:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 5, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiberna cum legato praefectoque tradidisses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:35:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 35, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Calvisius) duos legatos Uticae reliquerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestorius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:21:section=56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 21, § 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Caesar, cujus pater Caesaris erat legatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnitudo et splendor legati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:58:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 58, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in magna legatum quaere popina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:172" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 172</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26185.12" n="b" level="4"> Under the emperors, <hi rend="ital">a governor sent to a province by the emperor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 3</bibl> et saep.; cf. legatio, I. B. 2., and Orell. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 9</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n26185.13" n="(b)" level="5"> Legati legionum, <hi rend="ital">commanders</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar singulis legionibus singulos legatos et quaestorem praefecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 7</bibl>.—Also called; <cit><quote lang="la">legatus praetorius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26185.14" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">lēgātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (acc. to lego, II.), <hi rend="ital">a bequest, legacy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legatum est delibatio hereditatis, qua testator ex eo, quod universum heredis foret, alicui quid collatum velit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:116" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hortensii legata cognovi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliqua legata varie dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:101" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 101</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legatum peto ex testamento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus capiendi legata alicui adimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cymbala pulsantis legatum amici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:62" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legatorum genera sunt quattuor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:192" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 192</bibl></cit>; cf. sqq.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26186" type="main" key="le^go2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕgo</orth>, <itype>lēgi, lectum</itype> (<sense id="n26186.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur. part.</hi> legentum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1</bibl>. 7, 25), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">le/gw, lo/gos, loga/s</foreign>, etc.; Lat. legumen, di-leg-ens, neg-leg-o, etc.; cf. Germ. lesen</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to bring together, to gather, collect</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26186.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26186.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">oleam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:66:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 66, 265</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbas collibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:347" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 347</bibl></cit>: flores et humi nascentia fraga, <pb n="1048" /> <cb n="LEGO" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 92</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">roscida mala,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flores in calathos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:218" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spolia caesorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos (montanos asparagos),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:69" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 69</bibl></cit>.—Of the dead who have been burned: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 10, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homini mortuo ossa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:24:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 24, 60</bibl></cit>: ossa filii, Sen. de Ira, 2, 33, 6; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> de Mort. Persec. 21, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquias legerunt primores equestris ordinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:100" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 100</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n26186.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n26186.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To take out, pick out, extract, remove</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibusdam et radi ossa et legi ... quae sine totius pernicie corporis haerere non poterant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 1:3:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov. 1, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa vivis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ad Marc. 22:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Marc. 22, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa in capite lecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:24:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 5, 24, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa e vulneribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26186.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To pluck, strip, gather fruit from</hi> (a tree, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">oleam qui legerit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 144, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficus non erat apta legi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:254" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 254</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26186.6" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: legere fila, <hi rend="ital">to wind up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">extrema Lauso Parcae fila legunt,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>spin the last thread of life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:815" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 815</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae dedit ingrato fila legenda viro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:462" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 462</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 4, 40 (42).—</sense><sense id="n26186.7" n="4" level="3"> Naut. t. t.: vela legere, <hi rend="ital">to draw together, furl</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis navita ponto umida vela legit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:373" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 373</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vela legunt socii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:532" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 532</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse dabit tenera vela, legetque manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 215</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:13" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prora funem legit Argus ab alta,</quote> <trans><tr>draws in, takes in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:312" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 312</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ancoras classis legit,</quote> <trans><tr>is weighing anchor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 759" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 759</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26186.8" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To take to one's self unjustly, to carry off, steal, purloin, plunder, abstract</hi> (not in Cic.): omnia viscatis manibus leget, omnia sumet: crede mihi, auferet omnia, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 332</bibl> and 396, 4: <cit><quote lang="la">majus esse maleficium stuprare ingenuam quam sacrum legere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra divum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soceros legere et gremiis abducere pactas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 79</bibl></cit> Serv. ad loc. (but Forbig. renders legere here as = eligere, sumere; cf. 8. infra).—</sense><sense id="n26186.9" n="6" level="3"> Of places, <hi rend="ital">to go, pass</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">wander through</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">nec me studiosius altera saltus Legit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:579" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 579</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars cetera pontum Pone legit,</quote> <trans><tr>sails through</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 207</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vada dura lego,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 706</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">freta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequora Afra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:289" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 289</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ioniumque rapax Icariumque legit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:566" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 566</bibl></cit>: vestigia alicujus, <hi rend="ital">to follow one's footsteps, to track</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pursue him</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsequitur pressoque legit vestigia gressu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 3, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">et vestigia retro Observata legit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:392" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 392</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tortos orbes,</quote> <trans><tr>to wander through</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 481</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26186.10" n="7" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To pass</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sail by, to skirt, to coast along a shore, land</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">place</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Inarimen Prochytenque legit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 705</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">709</bibl>: primi litoris oram, <hi rend="ital">coast along</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">not enter into details</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 8, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">navibus oram Italiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 51 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oram Campaniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 16</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n26186.11" n="8" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to choose</hi> from a number, <hi rend="ital">to pick out, single out, select, elect</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">alia esse oportet forma quem tu pugno legeris,</quote> <trans><tr>pick out to fight with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia, quae leget quaeque reiciet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:15:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 15, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribam,</quote> <trans><tr>to elect, appoint</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:45:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 45, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condiciones nubendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cives in patres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viros ad bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:669" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 669</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">geminasque legit de classe biremes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 79</bibl></cit>: legit virum vir, <hi rend="ital">each one singles out his man</hi> (of the combatants in a battle), <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 632</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatum ad modum pristinum redegit duabus lectionibus: prima ipsorum arbitratu, quo vir virum legit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 18</bibl>: neque ejus legendam filiam (sc. virginem Vestalem) qui domicilium in Italia non haberet, At. Cap. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:12:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 12, 8</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n26186.12" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidissima custos Lecta sacrum justae veneri occultare pudorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:530" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 530</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n26186.13" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> * </sense><sense id="n26186.14" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To catch up</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">overhear</hi> a conversation: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc huc concedam, ut horum sermonem legam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 4, 21</bibl></cit> (cf. sublegere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 2</bibl>. 98).—</sense><sense id="n26186.15" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To catch with the eye, to view, observe, behold, survey, see</hi>. * </sense><sense id="n26186.16" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">tumulum capit, unde omnes longo ordine posset Adversos legere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:755" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 755</bibl></cit> Heyne ad loc.; and cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 34</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26186.17" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to read</hi> or <hi rend="ital">peruse</hi> a writing: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eos libros per te ipse legeres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:chapter=1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defensionem causae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:43:section=112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 43, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legi apud Clitomachum, A. Albium jocantem dixisse, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 45, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid studiose intenteque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">significas legisse te in quadam epistula mea, jussisse Verginium, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 9:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: philosophorum<cb n="LEGU" />  consultorumque opiniones, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">liber tuus et lectus est et legitur a me diligenter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aiunt multum legendum esse non multa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 9, 15</bibl></cit>.—With a <hi rend="ital">pers. obj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiquos et novos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiquos studiosius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëtas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 4, 4</bibl></cit>. —In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Horatius fere solus legi dignus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:96" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si cum judicio legatur Cassius Severus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:116" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dumque legar, mecum pariter tua fama legetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:14:5" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepulcra legens,</quote> <trans><tr>when reading epitaphs</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legentium plerisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1 praef.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">4: opus nescio an minimae legentibus futurum voluptati,</quote> <trans><tr>to my readers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:3" default="NO">2, 5, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec Cynicos nec Stoica dogmata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:121" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 121</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">legendi usus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 25, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriam continuus legendi usus instruit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26186.18" n="b" level="4"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n26186.19" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To read out, read aloud, recite</hi> (esp. freq. in post-Aug. authors): <cit><quote lang="la">convocatis auditoribus volumen legere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:51:191" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 51, 191</bibl></cit>: codicem pro contione, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:4:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 4, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">audio me male legere, dumtaxat versus, orationes enim commodius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obturem impune legentibus aures,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem vero arripuit tenet occiditque legendo,</quote> <trans><tr>with recitation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:475" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 475</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis dabit historico quantum daret acta legenti,</quote> <trans><tr>to read him the news</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:104" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 104</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26186.20" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To find</hi> in an author or a writing: <cit><quote lang="la">ut scriptum legimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legi etiam scriptum, esse avem quandam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:chapter=2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2</bibl></cit>. 49 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego vero haec scripta legi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:39:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 39, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeterea scriptum legimus, Gallos in venatibus tinguere sagittas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:15:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 15, 7</bibl></cit>. relatum legere, Nep. praef. 1.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliis codicibus non peccato sed peccatis legitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Cont. Jul. Rel. 1:22" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Cont. Jul. Rel. 1, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Don. Persev. 6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Don. Persev. 6 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl> al.—</sense><sense id="n26186.21" n="C" level="2"> A publicist's t. t.: legere senatum, <hi rend="ital">to read over</hi> or <hi rend="ital">call off the names of senators</hi> (which was done by the censors; <cit><quote lang="la">v. lectio, II. A. 2.): censores fideli concordia senatum legerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:29" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:30" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 30</bibl>; 9, 46; 43, 15 al.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕgens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> as <hi rend="ital">subst. m., a reader</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose for lector), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:7:25" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 7, 25</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, Liv. praef. 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 16, 17, § 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 33</bibl>.—Also, <orth extent="full" lang="la">lectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., chosen, picked out, selected; choice, excellent</hi> (class.): argenti lectae numeratae minae, <hi rend="ital">good</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of full weight</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 50</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">argentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut neque vir melior neque lectior femina in terris sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:31:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 31, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectissimi viri atque ornatissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:6:section=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 6, § 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:9:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 9, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxor lectissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:31:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 31, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(verbis) lectis atque illustribus uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:37:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 37, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est aliud ... pulcre et oratorie dicere nisi optimis sententiis verbisque lectissimis dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:68:227" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 68, 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenum lectissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:247" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 247</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">viginti lectis equitum comitatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 48</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lectē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">choicely, selectly</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ab lego lecte ac lectissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=36" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 36</bibl></cit> Müll.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:54:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 54, 2</bibl></cit> (al. lecta).</sense></entryFree>
legula: <entryFree id="n26187" type="main" key="legu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">legŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n26187.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a flap</hi>: auris, <hi rend="ital">the earflap</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">aurium legulae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: Legula, <foreign lang="greek">mu/tron</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
leguleius: <entryFree id="n26188" type="main" key="le_gu^le_ius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēgŭlēïus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>lex</etym>, <sense id="n26188.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pettifogging lawyer, pettifogger</hi>, one who depends on legal technicalities for getting the better of his opponent: <cit><quote lang="la">leguleius quidam cautus et acutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:55:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 55, 236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formularii, vel ut Cicero ait, leguleii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 3, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
legulus: <entryFree id="n26189" type="main" key="le^gu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕgŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>2. lego</etym>, <sense id="n26189.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gatherer, collector;</hi> esp. <hi rend="ital">one who picked up the fallen olives</hi> (opp. strictor, he who beat or shook them from the tree; <cit><quote lang="la">ante- and post-class.): ab legendo leguli, qui oleam aut qui uvas legunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=66" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 66</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5</bibl>, § <cit><quote lang="la">94: legulos quot opus erunt, praebeto et strictores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leguli volunt ut olea caduca quam plurima sit, quo plus legatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:3:49" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 3, 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
legumen: <entryFree id="n26190" type="main" key="le^gu_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕgūmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26190.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pulse, any leguminous plant</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26190.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:23:32" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 23, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 17, 46, § 165</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:7:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:1" default="NO">2, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:18:7:10" default="NO">18, 7, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra feta frugibus et vario leguminum genere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:62:156" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 62, 156</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 47 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventri indulgere omne legumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:174" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frugibus legatis, legumina continentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 6, 78</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Collect. sing.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0972,001:135:5" default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> S. 135, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26190.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">the bean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetum siliqua quassante legumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 74</bibl></cit>. <cb n="LEMN" /></sense></entryFree>
legumentum: <entryFree id="n26191" type="hapax" key="le^gu_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕgūmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>legumen</etym>, <sense id="n26191.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pulse</hi> (for legumen), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:11:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 11, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leguminarius: <entryFree id="n26192" type="gloss" key="le^gu_mi^na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕgūmĭnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26192.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to pulse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">NEGOTIATRIX LEGVMINARIA,</quote> <trans><tr>dealing in pulse</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3093</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕgūmĭnārĭus</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">o)spriopw/lhs</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
leiostrea: <entryFree id="n26193" type="greek" key="leiostre^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">leiostrĕa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">līostrĕa</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">leio/streon</foreign>, <sense id="n26193.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an oyster with a smooth shell</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 19, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leleges: <entryFree id="n26194" type="main" key="Le^le^ges"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĕlĕges</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*le/leges</foreign>, <sense id="n26194.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Pelasgic tribe who lived scattered over several parts of Asia Minor and Greece</hi> (in Caria, lonia, Mysia, Thessaly, Locris, Megara), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 12, § 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:127" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 30, 33, § 127</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:725" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 725</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:645" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 645</bibl>;
