<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:383" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 383</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>: hac Ixionides, illa Troezenius heros parte Lelex, <hi rend="ital">the Lelegeian</hi>, as a proper name, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:566" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 566</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26194.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n26194.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĕ-lĕgēïus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Leleges, Lelegeian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the coast of Megara</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Megara</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:443" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 443</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26194.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĕlĕgēis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Lelegeian, Asiatic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nymphae Lelegeides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:651" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 651</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst., an early name of Miletus, because formerly inhabited by the Leleges</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 112</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lelepris: <entryFree id="n26195" type="main" key="le^le_^pris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕlē^pris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n26195.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fish</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 149</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lema: <entryFree id="n26196" type="main" key="le_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lh/mh</foreign>, <sense id="n26196.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a humor</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rheum that gathers in the corner of the eye</hi> (also called grāmiae), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 24, § 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lemannus: <entryFree id="n26197" type="main" key="Le^mannus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĕmannus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (with or without lacus), <sense id="n26197.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Lake of Geneva</hi>.—Without lacus: <cit><quote lang="la">deseruere cavo tentoria fixa Lemanno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:396" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 396</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 224</bibl>.—With lacus: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhodanus, Lemanno lacu acceptus tenet impetum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:5:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 5, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:5:1" default="NO">2, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:396" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 396</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 635</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lembulus: <entryFree id="n26198" type="main" key="lembu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lembŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>lembus</etym>, <sense id="n26198.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small boat, a wherry</hi>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 5, 455.</sense></entryFree>
lembunculus: <entryFree id="n26199" type="main" key="lembuncu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lembuncŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. 2. lenunculus.</entryFree>
lembus: <entryFree id="n26200" type="greek" key="lembus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lembus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">le/mbos</foreign>, <sense id="n26200.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small fastsailing vessel with a sharp prow, a pinnace, yacht, cutter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lembus genus navicellae velocissimae, quod et dromonis nomine appellamus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Exp. Serm. 564, 6</bibl></cit>; Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 534, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">celerare lembum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0146,001:ib. 7" default="NO"><author>Turp.</author> ib. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lembo advehitur pauxillulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ascendi in lembum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducit lembum jam dierectum navis praeditoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 3, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classis lemborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:35" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui adverso vix flumine lembum Remigiis subigit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 201</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piratici lembi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:5:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 5, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lemma: <entryFree id="n26201" type="greek" key="lemma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lemma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lh=mma</foreign>, <sense id="n26201.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a subject for consideration</hi> or <hi rend="ital">explanation, a theme, matter, subject, contents</hi> (not ante-Aug.; in Cic. only written as Greek). </sense><sense id="n26201.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lemma sibi sumpsit, quod ego interdum versibus ludo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 27, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26201.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26201.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The title</hi> of an epigram, because it indicates the subject: <cit><quote lang="la">lemmata si quaeris, cur sint ascripta, docebo: Ut si malueris lemmata sola legas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:2:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; Aus. Parent. praef.—</sense><sense id="n26201.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The epigram</hi> itself: <cit><quote lang="la">si mihi ex hoc ipso lemmate secundus versus occurrerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 27, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consumpta est uno si lemmate pagina, transis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:59:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 59, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n26201.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A story, tale</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nutricis lemmata,</quote> <trans><tr>nursery-tales</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 16, 90</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26201.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The assumption</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lemma</hi> of a syllogism: <cit><quote lang="la">est vitium insidiosum et sub falsa lemmatis specie latens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:16:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 16, 7</bibl></cit>; v. sumptio.</sense></entryFree>
lemniacus: <entryFree id="n26202" type="main" key="Lemni^a^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lemnĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Lemnos, II. B.</entryFree>
lemnias: <entryFree id="n26203" type="main" key="Lemni^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lemnĭas</orth>, <itype>adis</itype>, v. Lemnos, II. D.</entryFree>
lemnicola: <entryFree id="n26204" type="main" key="Lemni^co^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lemnĭcŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Lemnos, II. E.</entryFree>
lemniensis: <entryFree id="n26205" type="main" key="Lemni^ensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lemnĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. Lemnos, II. C.</entryFree>
lemniscatus: <entryFree id="n26206" type="main" key="lemnisca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lemniscātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lemniscus</etym>, <sense id="n26206.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adorned with pendent ribbons</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corona,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 5, 269</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 772</bibl>: palma, lit., <hi rend="ital">a palm-branch ornamented with ribbons</hi>, the highest reward of a victor; hence, transf., for <hi rend="ital">highest reward</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palma (as the reward for a murder),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:35:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 35, 100</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lemniscus: <entryFree id="n26207" type="greek" key="lemniscus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lemniscus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lhmni/skos</foreign>. <sense id="n26207.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A pendent (purple?) ribbon</hi>, fastened to a victor's crown, at first of linden-bast or wool, afterwards of gold. A crown adorned with such a ribbon was the highest reward of a victor: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuissimae earum (tiliarum), philyrae, coronarum lemniscis celebres, antiquorum honore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 14, 25, § 65</bibl></cit>: lemnisci id est fascicolae coloriae, dependentes ex coronis, propterea dicuntur, quod <pb n="1049" /> <cb n="LENA" /> antiquissimum fuit genus coronarum lanearum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=115" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 115</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 3, 4, § 6</bibl>.—Such crowns were given as especial honors to guests at a feast: <cit><quote lang="la">unguenta atque odores, lemniscos, corollas dari dapsilas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coronae datae lemniscis aureis interpositis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Verr. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba coronas lemniscosque jacientium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 33, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingestaeque aves, ac lemnisci, et bellaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 25</bibl></cit>.—Crowns ornamented in this manner were given, also, to the victors in public games and to poets: <cit><quote lang="la">et quae jamdudum tibi palma poëtica pollet, Lemnisco ornata est, quo mea palma caret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epist. 20, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:35:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 35, 100</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26207.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A tent</hi> or <hi rend="ital">roll of lint dipped in a medicament</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 14, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 48, 7</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 28</bibl>, written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
lemnos: <entryFree id="n26208" type="main" key="Lemnos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lemnos</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lemnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lh=mnos</foreign>, <sense id="n26208.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the island of Lemnos, in the Ægean Sea; in mythology, the abode of Vulcan; it was also here that Philoctetes was left behind;</hi> now <hi rend="ital">Lemno</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Stalimeni</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 23, § 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:22:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 22, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:16:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 16, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">313</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:49" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:87" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 87</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n26208.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n26208.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lemnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Lemnos, Lemnian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia tibi alia est sponsa locuples Lemnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: litora, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 11</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">furtum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Prometheus, who stole the fire from Vulcan at Lemnos</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:10:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 10, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:29:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 29, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pater,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Vulcan</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:454" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 454</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba,</quote> <trans><tr>the women of Lemnos, who in one night all killed their husbands</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:398" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 398</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubrica,</quote> <trans><tr>a kind of red chalk</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 8, 24, § 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:104" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 5, 33, § 104</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lemnĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Vulcan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lemnius extemplo valvas patefecit eburnas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 185</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lemnii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">inhabitants of Lemnos, Lemnians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26208.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lemnĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Lemnian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec major ab antris Lemniacis fragor est,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Vulcan's forge in Lemnos</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:1:131" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 1, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">catenae,</quote> <trans><tr>the fetters made by Vulcan in Lemnos with which to bind Venus and Mars</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:274" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 3, 274</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:7:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 7, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26208.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lemnĭen-sis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Lemnian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sua cognata Lemniensis,</quote> <trans><tr>from Lemnos</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 99</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n26208.5" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lemnĭas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lhmnia/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a Lemnian woman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 53</bibl>.—With Gr. form of <hi rend="ital">dat. plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lemniasi gladios in mea damna dabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:672" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 672</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsul,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Hypsipyle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:500" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 500</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26208.6" n="E" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lem-nĭcŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the dweller in Lemnos</hi>, a surname of Vulcan: <cit><quote lang="la">Lemnicolae stirps,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Erichthonius, son of Vulcan</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:757" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 757</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lemonia: <entryFree id="n26209" type="main" key="Lemoni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lemonĭa trĭbus</orth>, <sense id="n26209.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rustic tribe on the</hi> Via Latina, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:16:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 16, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 9, 7, 15</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=115" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 115</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
lemonium: <entryFree id="n26210" type="greek" key="le_mo_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēmōnĭum</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">līmōnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">leimw/nion</foreign>, <sense id="n26210.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the wild beet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 9, 61, § 108</bibl> (al. molenonium); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 8, 28, § 72</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lemovices: <entryFree id="n26211" type="main" key="Le^mo^vi_ces"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĕmŏvīces</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26211.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Aquitanian Gaul, neighbors of the Arverni;</hi> their name, as applied to their ancient capital, is preserved in the modern form of <hi rend="ital">Limoges</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 75, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 19, 33, § 109</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lemovii: <entryFree id="n26212" type="main" key="Lemovi^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lemovĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26212.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Germanic people on the Baltic, bordering on the Rugii</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rugii et Lemovii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lemunculus: <entryFree id="n26213" type="gloss" key="lemuncu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lemuncŭlus</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">pi/tulos, skafi/dion</foreign>, Gloss. Lat. Gr. [lembus].</entryFree>
lemures: <entryFree id="n26214" type="main" key="Le^mu^res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĕmŭres</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26214.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">shades, ghosts</hi> of the departed. </sense><sense id="n26214.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lemures animas dixere silentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:483" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 483</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26214.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">ghosts, spectres</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lemures larvae nocturnae et terrificationes imaginum et bestiarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 135, 15 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnia, terrores magicos, miracula, sagas, Nocturnos lemures portentaque Thessala rides,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc nigri lemures ovoque pericula rupto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:185" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 185</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n26214.3" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĕmū-rĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a festival held on the 9th, 11th, and 13th of May to appease the ghosts of the departed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocturna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:421 sq" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 421 sq.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
lena: <entryFree id="n26215" type="main" key="le_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>leno</etym>, <sense id="n26215.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bawd, procuress</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26215.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenas eas dicimus, quae mulieres quaestuarias prostituunt. Lenam accipiemus et eam, quae alterius nomine hoc vitae genus exercet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:2:43" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes sunt lenae levifidae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 3, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">callida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:11" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 11</bibl></cit> (5, 48): <cit><quote lang="la">improba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:15:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 15, 17</bibl></cit>.— <cb n="LENI" /> In apposition: <cit><quote lang="la">lena anus,</quote> <trans><tr>an old go-between</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 5, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Isiaca,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Isis</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:489" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 489</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenui prohibentur ducere ... et lenam et a lenone lenave manumissam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 13, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26215.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">she that entices, allures, seduces; a female enticer, a seductress</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non vides, quam blanda conciliatrix, et quasi sui sit lena natura?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:27:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 27, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro facie multis vox sua lena fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:316" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 316</bibl></cit>: pictura lena, Claud. Nupt. Honor. et Mar. 24.</sense></entryFree>
lenaeus: <entryFree id="n26216" type="main" key="Le_naeus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lēnaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lhnai=os</foreign>, <sense id="n26216.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Lenæan, Bacchic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lenaei latices,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>wine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:510" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 510</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honorem libare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 207</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lenaea dona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:6:80" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 6, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lenaeus pater,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Bacchus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 132</bibl>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lēnaeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Bacchus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">te libans, Lenaee, vocat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:529" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 529</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:6:38" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 6, 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26217" type="main" key="Le_naeus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lēnaeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n26217.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A surname of a king</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:331" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 331</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n26217.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A name of Roman slaves</hi>, e. g. Cn. Pompeius Lenaeus, <hi rend="ital">a freedman of Pompey</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 30, 39, § 127</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lene: <entryFree id="n26218" type="main" key="le_ne"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēne</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. lenis <sense id="n26218.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
lenimen: <entryFree id="n26219" type="main" key="le_ni_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēnīmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>lenio</etym>, <sense id="n26219.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a softening</hi> or <hi rend="ital">soothing remedy; an alleviation, mitigation, solace</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">testudo laborum Dulce lenimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:32:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 32, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitae lenimen dulce senectae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:500" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 500</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">addidit illis hoc quoque lenimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:450" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 450</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lenimentum: <entryFree id="n26220" type="main" key="le_ni_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēnīmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26220.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a softening</hi> or <hi rend="ital">soothing remedy; an alleviation, mollification</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n26220.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 5, 24, § 59</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26220.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">addito honestae missionis lenimento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 67</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lenio: <entryFree id="n26221" type="main" key="le_ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēnĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi or ĭi, ītum, 4</itype> (<sense id="n26221.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imperf.</hi> lenibant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:528" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 528</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenibat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 468</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> lenibunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:20" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 20</bibl> (4, 21), 32), <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. lenis</etym>. </sense><sense id="n26221.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to make soft</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mild, to soften, mollify, alleviate, mitigate, assuage, soothe, calm</hi> (syn.: mitigo, placo, sedo, mulceo). </sense><sense id="n26221.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapsana alvum lenit et mollit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 9, 37, § 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuces leniunt saporem caeparum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 8, 77, § 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 6, 35, § 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collectiones impetusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 25, 58, § 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stomachum latrantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volnera,</quote> <trans><tr>to assuage, heal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:20" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 20</bibl></cit> (4, 21), 32: <cit><quote lang="la">clamorem,</quote> <trans><tr>to soften, moderate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:27:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 27, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inopiam frumenti lenire,</quote> <trans><tr>to make amends for, cause to be less felt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 91</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26221.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to render mild, to appease, calm, pacify</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">senem illum tibi dedo ulteriorem, ut lenitum reddas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum saepe lenivi iratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temperantia animos placat ac lenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:14:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 14, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te ipsum dies leniet, aetas mitigabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:31:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 31, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epulis multitudinem imperitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:45:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 45, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desiderium crebris epistolis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se multa consolatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem tempusque ... leniturum iras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum ferocem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepius fatigatus lenitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 111:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 111, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenire dolentem Solando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:393" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 393</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n26221.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to become soft</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mild, to be softened, mitigated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum irae leniunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 100</bibl></cit>; cf. Brix ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
lenis: <entryFree id="n26222" type="main" key="le_nis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēnis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cf. lentus</etym>, <sense id="n26222.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">soft, smooth, mild, gentle, easy, calm</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26222.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensus judicat dulce, amarum: lene, asperum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:12:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 12, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:58:146" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 58, 146</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehemens fricatio spissat, lenis mollit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 14, § 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum hoc asperum est: aliud lenius, sodes, vide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenibus venenis uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenissimus ventus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus laterum,</quote> <trans><tr>moderate, gentle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:92" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 92</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:161" default="NO">161</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">leni igni sucus coquitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 18, 73, § 122</bibl></cit>.—Of the Nile: <cit><quote lang="la">postea lenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 10, § 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tormentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:21:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 21, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:527" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 527</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 1, 21</bibl></cit>.—Of heights, <hi rend="ital">gently</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gradually rising</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clivus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 33</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugum paulo leniore fastigio ab ea parte quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 24</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so fastigium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 36, 64, § 158</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26222.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">gentle, moderate, mild, lenient, calm</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26222.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">servitutem lenem reddere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ecce me. Opusne (erit tibi) leni? leniorem dices quam mutumst mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo lenis et facilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus Romanus in hostes lenissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:53:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 53, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenissima verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenissimum ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:56:204" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 56, 204</bibl></cit>: lenior sententia, <cb n="LENO" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 2</bibl>: lene consilium dare, Hor C. 3, 4, 41.—</sense><sense id="n26222.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non lenis precibus fata recludere Mercurius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:24:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 24, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26222.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n26222.6" n="1" level="3"> Of speech, <hi rend="ital">mild, gentle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio placida, submissa, lenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:43:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 43, 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenis et fluens contextus orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:127" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leniores epilogi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 1, 50</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26222.7" n="2" level="3"> In gram.: spiritus, <hi rend="ital">the spiritus lenis, the smooth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">soft breathing</hi> (opp. the spiritus asper), <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 572</bibl> P.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos> in two forms. </sense><sense id="n26222.8" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">lēne</orth> (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <hi rend="ital">softly, mildly, gently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sectus humum rivo, lene sonantis aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:704" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 704</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clivi lene jacentes,</quote> <trans><tr>gently rising</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:7:25" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 7, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lene fluens fons,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Ecl. 4, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lene Notus spirat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Descript. Orb. 857</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26222.9" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">lēnĭter</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">class.</orth>), <hi rend="ital">softly, mildly, gently</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26222.10" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">leniter arridens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:12:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 12, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leniter atterens Caudam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:19:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 19, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventus leniter pluvius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:337" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 34, 77, § 337</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leniter ire per excubias custodum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: collis leniter acclivis, <hi rend="ital">gradually</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gently rising</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 19</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">editus collis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 50</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">torrens lenius decurrit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:568" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 568</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26222.11" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">quietly, calmly, gently, moderately, leniently</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26222.12" n="a" level="4"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">tentem leniter an minaciter?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petere quippiam ab aliquo dictis bonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. prol. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferre aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">traducere aevum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis leniter latam suam injuriam ratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 9</bibl></cit> (al. leviter).—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenissime sentire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26222.13" n="b" level="4"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n26222.14" n="(a)" level="5"> Of speech: <cit><quote lang="la">multa leniter, multa aspere dicta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:44:164" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 44, 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agit versum Roscius quam leniter, quam remisse, quam non actuose,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:26:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 26, 102</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui jamdiu multo dicis remissius et lenius quam solebas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:60:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 60, 255</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n26222.15" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Moderately</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">very little, not at all</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc leniter laudabitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 3, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">leniter qui saeviunt sapiunt magis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26222.16" n="(g)" level="5"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">remissly, indolently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si cunctetur atque agat lenius,</quote> <trans><tr>too slowly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26223" type="main" key="lenis2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lenis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26223.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of vessel</hi>, Afran. and Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 544, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lenitas: <entryFree id="n26224" type="main" key="le_ni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēnĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. lenis</etym>, <sense id="n26224.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">softness, smoothness, gentleness, mildness</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26224.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vini, opp. asperitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 19, 24, § 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 12, 26, § 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arar in Rhodanum influit incredibili lenitate,</quote> <trans><tr>slowness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocis,</quote> <trans><tr>mildness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:43:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 43, 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">smaragdi viridis lenitas,</quote> <trans><tr>delicate green</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 5, 16, § 63</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26224.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26224.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">mildness, gentleness, tenderness, lenity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est jam lenitati locus, severitatem res ipsa flagitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare se ad lenitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi, with mollitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animadvertendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:22:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 22, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remissa nimis lenitate uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:18:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 18, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26224.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of speech: <cit><quote lang="la">elaborant alii in lenitate et aequabilitate, et puro quasi quodam et candido genere dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:16:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 16, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenitas ejus sine nervis perspici potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:48:177" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 48, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus orationis cum lenitate quadam aequabili profluens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:15:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 15, 64</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
leniter: <entryFree id="n26225" type="main" key="le_ni^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēnĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. lenis <sense id="n26225.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
lenities: <entryFree id="n26226" type="hapax" key="le_ni^ti^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēnĭtĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. lenis</etym>, <sense id="n26226.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mildness, gentleness</hi>: non sine lenitie, Schol. Ambros. ad Cic. Or. ap. Clod. et Cur. p. 20 Mai.</sense></entryFree>
lenitudo: <entryFree id="n26227" type="main" key="le_ni^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēnĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26227.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">softness, mildness, gentleness, calmness</hi> (very rare): orationis, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:16:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 16, 46</bibl> (Trag. Fragm. v. 247 Rib.): mira lenitudine ac suavitate abundat, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 132, 3</bibl> (Com. Fragm. v. 189 Rib.): nimia in aliquem lenitudo, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:61:section=136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 61, § 136</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leno: <entryFree id="n26228" type="main" key="le_no1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēno</orth>, no <sense id="n26228.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [2. leno]. </sense><sense id="n26228.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to pimp, pander</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): lenandi callidus arte, Poët. ap. Anth. Lat. T. 1, p. 611 Burm.—</sense><sense id="n26228.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to procure</hi>: filiam suam, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:233" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 233</bibl>: formosas puellas, Epigr. ap. Salmas. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Car. 16</bibl>: lenatae puellae, Poët. ap. Anth. Lat. T. 2, p. 587.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26229" type="main" key="le_no2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēno</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>lenio</etym>, <sense id="n26229.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pimp, pander, procurer</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26229.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">perjurus leno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leno me peregre militi Macedonico Minis viginti vendidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">importunus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:prol. 44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. prol. 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leno sum, fateor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">improbissimus et perjurissimus leno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidiosus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba facit leno, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 231</bibl></cit>: cum <pb n="1050" /> <cb n="LENT" /> leno accipiat moechi bona, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:55" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 55</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26229.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26229.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A seducer, allurer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenonem quendam Lentuli concursare circum tabernas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 8, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(puella) me lenone placet,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>through my intervention</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 12, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26229.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A go-between</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:3:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 3, 8</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: se Narcissus amat captus lenonibus undis, <hi rend="ital">alluring, seductive</hi>, Anth. Lat. T. 1, p. 102 Burm.</sense></entryFree>
lenocinamentum: <entryFree id="n26230" type="main" key="le_no_ci^na_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēnōcĭnāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>lenocinor</etym>, <sense id="n26230.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an allurement</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lenocinatio: <entryFree id="n26231" type="main" key="le_no_ci^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēnōcĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26231.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flattery</hi> (late Lat), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Ps. 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lenocinator: <entryFree id="n26232" type="hapax" key="le_no_ci^na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēnōcĭnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26232.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who obtains</hi> any thing <hi rend="ital">by flattery</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiae lenocinator,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
lenocinium: <entryFree id="n26233" type="main" key="le_no_ci^ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēnōcĭnĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>leno</etym>, <sense id="n26233.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the trade of a pander, pimping, pandering</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26233.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ait praetor: Qui lenocinium fecerit. Lenocinium facit, qui quaestuaria mancipia habet. Sed et qui in liberis hunc quaestum exercet, in eadem causa est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:2:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid? ego lenocinium facio?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 4, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxori meae Mihique objectent lenocinium facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profiteri,</quote> <trans><tr>to profess to be a bawd</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praebere uxori,</quote> <trans><tr>to be a pander to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:3:47" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 24, 3, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum qui in adulterio deprehensam uxorem non statim dimiserit, reum lenocinii postulari placuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 2, 26, 8</bibl></cit>; Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 4, 12, 4.—</sense><sense id="n26233.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26233.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An allurement, enticement</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:35:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 35, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:66:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 66, 138</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26233.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Excessive</hi> or <hi rend="ital">artificial ornament, finery</hi> or <hi rend="ital">nicety in dress</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporum lenocinia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:58:146" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 58, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis lenocinii negligens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:79" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenocinium est muneris antecedens metus,</quote> <trans><tr>adds a charm to the benefit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:11:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 11, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in lenocinio commendationis dolor est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 145</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26233.5" n="2" level="3"> In partic., of speech, <hi rend="ital">meretricious or nament</hi> or <hi rend="ital">allurement</hi> (postAug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos quibus sordent omnia, quae natura dictavit: qui non ornamenta quaerimus, sed lenocinia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl></cit> prooem. § 26; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 1, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caret lenociniis expositio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:118" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 118</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lenocinor: <entryFree id="n26234" type="main" key="le_no_ci^nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēnōcĭnor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>1. leno; lit., to pander; hence, transf.</etym>. <sense id="n26234.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To flatter, entice, allure, wheedle, cajole</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">blandior, adulor): tibi serviet, tibi lenocinabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:15:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 15, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriae alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui captatione testamenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 14, 57, § 160</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26234.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To forward, serve, promote, advance</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut libro isti novitas lenocinetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:19:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 19, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anceps hic et lubricus locus est, etiam cum illi necessitas lenocinatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 1:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo vitio mancipiorum negotiatores formae puerorum lenocinantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 12, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Harii insitae feritati arte ac tempore lenocinantur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>increase, add to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
lenonice: <entryFree id="n26235" type="hapax" key="le_no_ni^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēnōnĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26235.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">like a pimp</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae lenonice faceret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Commod. 15</bibl></cit> (al. lenonie).</sense></entryFree>
lenonius: <entryFree id="n26236" type="main" key="le_no_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēnōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26236.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to pimping</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pandering</hi>: non periclumst nequid recte monstres. <hi rend="ital">Ba.</hi> Non lenoniumst (sc. recte monstrare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 3</bibl>. 3, 29: <cit><quote lang="la">servitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 5, 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoi servitutem di danunt lenoniam Puero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: pueri, Verr. Fl. Fragm. Fast. Praenest. ad VII. K. Maias (in <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> T. 2, p. 410</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">lutum lenonium, as a term of reproach,</quote> <trans><tr>filthy pander</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam ego hoc ipsum oppidum expugnatum faxo erit lenonium,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>will outwit this pander</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter lenonius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 99</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lēnōniē</orth>, v. lenonice.</sense></entryFree>
lens: <entryFree id="n26237" type="main" key="lens1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lens</orth>, <itype>dis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n26237.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a louse's egg, a nit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lendes tolluntur adipe canino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 35, § 111</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 5, 72</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26238" type="main" key="lens2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lens</orth>, <itype>tis</itype> (<case>nom.</case> lentis, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 764</bibl> P.—<sense id="n26238.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> lentim, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">116</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 101</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">lentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 15</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi> lenti, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 210, 5</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> lentes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 114" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 114</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> (<hi rend="ital">masc.</hi>, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 210, 5</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">a lentil</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lens amat solum tenue,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 12, 31, § 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pelusiaca (Egyptian lentils were considered the best),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 228</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:9:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:8:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 8, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lente: <entryFree id="n26239" type="main" key="lente_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lentē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. lentus <sense id="n26239.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
lenteo: <entryFree id="n26240" type="hapax" key="lente^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lentĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>lentus</etym>, <sense id="n26240.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to proceed</hi> <cb n="LENT" /> <hi rend="ital">slowly</hi>: lentet opus, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 800</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
lentesco: <entryFree id="n26241" type="main" key="lentesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lentesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n26241.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [lentus], <hi rend="ital">to become viscous</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sticky; to become pliant, soft</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n26241.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">salix, si minus lenta est, in stercore obruenda, ut lentescat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:92" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed picis in morem ad digitos lentescit habendo,</quote> <trans><tr>becomes viscous, adheres</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 250</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in picem resinamve lentescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemma cerae modo lentescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 70, § 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metallum in virgulas lentescens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 24</bibl></cit>, n. 3.—</sense><sense id="n26241.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to slacken, relax</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lentescunt tempore curae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:357" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 357</bibl></cit>. —Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">non torpenti lentescit affectu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 8, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lenticula: <entryFree id="n26242" type="main" key="lenti^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lentĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>2. lens</etym>, <sense id="n26242.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lentil.</hi> </sense><sense id="n26242.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">faba vel lenticula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc mense lenticulam seres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26242.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26242.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The shape of a lentil, lentilshape</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 12, 75, § 196</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26242.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A vessel shaped like a lentil</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa fictilia (quas a similitudine lenticulas vocant),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:17:section=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 17, § 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 10, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26242.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A freckly eruption, freckles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 1, 5, § 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenticulam tollunt galbanum et nitrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. lentigo.</sense></entryFree>
lenticularis: <entryFree id="n26243" type="hapax" key="lenti^cu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lentĭcŭlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lenticula</etym>, <sense id="n26243.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">like a lentil</hi>: ampulla lenticulari formā, <hi rend="ital">lentilshaped</hi>, App. Flor. n. 9, p. 346, 26.</sense></entryFree>
lentiginosus: <entryFree id="n26244" type="hapax" key="lenti_gi^no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lentīgĭnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lentigo</etym>, <sense id="n26244.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of freckles, freckled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir lentiginosi oris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:7:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 7, 6</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">ext</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
lentigo: <entryFree id="n26245" type="main" key="lenti_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lentīgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. lens</etym>, <sense id="n26245.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lentil-shaped spot</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26245.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">stellio plenus lentigine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 28, § 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chartae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 12, 25, § 81</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26245.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a freckly eruption, freckles, lentigo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lentiginem habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 2, 6, § 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciem lentigine obducit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 4, 22, § 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lentiginem corrigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 25, 74, § 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emendare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 1, 16, § 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 9, 38, § 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lentigines e facie tollere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 2, 4, § 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lentinus: <entryFree id="n26246" type="main" key="Lenti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lentīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26246.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a man</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:43" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lentipes: <entryFree id="n26247" type="hapax" key="lenti^pe_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lentĭpēs</orth>, <itype>ĕdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lentus-pes</etym>, <sense id="n26247.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slowfooted, slow-paced</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">comes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 21, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lentiscifer: <entryFree id="n26248" type="hapax" key="lentisci^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lentiscĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lentiscus-fero</etym>, <sense id="n26248.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bearing mastic-trees</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Linternum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:713" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 713</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lentiscinus: <entryFree id="n26249" type="main" key="lentisci^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lentiscĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lentiscus</etym>, <sense id="n26249.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from the mastic-tree</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 2, 32, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">resina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 6, 22, § 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:37:197 al" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 37, 197 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
lentiscus: <entryFree id="n26250" type="main" key="lentiscus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lentiscus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">lentiscum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n26250.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the mastic - tree</hi>, Pistacia lentiscus, Linn. </sense><sense id="n26250.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: viridis semperque gravata Lentiscus, Cic. poët. Div. 1, 9, 15.—</sense><sense id="n26250.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26250.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Mastic-oil</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:60" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 6, 6, § 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26250.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A toothpick of mastic-wood</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:22:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 22, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:82:9" default="NO">3, 82, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:74:3" default="NO">6, 74, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lentitia: <entryFree id="n26251" type="main" key="lenti^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lentĭtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">lentĭtĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Aetn.</author> 540</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>lentus</etym>, <sense id="n26251.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pliancy, flexibility, toughness, viscosity, stickiness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgas sequacis ad vincturas lentitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 37, 68, § 174</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:210" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 40, 77, § 210</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lactucae lentitiam pituitae digerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 7, 26, § 64</bibl></cit>; cf. lentor.</sense></entryFree>
lentitudo: <entryFree id="n26252" type="main" key="lenti^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lentĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26252.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slowness, sluggishness, inactivity</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26252.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjuratorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:11:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 11, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26252.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <hi rend="ital">dulness, apathy, insensibility</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:19:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 19, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnino non irasci est non solum gravitatis, sed nonnumquam etiam lentitudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:13:section=38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 13, § 38</bibl></cit>.—Of speech: <cit><quote lang="la">libros ejusdem lentitudinis ac teporis,</quote> <trans><tr>dulness, heaviness</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 21, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lento: <entryFree id="n26253" type="main" key="lento1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lento</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26253.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make flexible, to bend</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postclass. prose). </sense><sense id="n26253.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcus lentare et fundere glandes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to draw a bow</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 436</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">arcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:703" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 1, 703</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gortynia cornua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 587</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26253.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to bend</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">ply</hi> the oar: <cit><quote lang="la">Trinacriā lentandus remus in undā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:384" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 384</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agm. 437" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agm. 437</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26253.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26253.4" n="A" level="2"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">to draw out, prolong, lengthen, protract</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lentare fervida bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:11" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 11</bibl></cit>: fata Romana lentata, Treb. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26253.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To moderate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lentatus vapor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 22, 191</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26254" type="main" key="Lento2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lento</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>lentus, sluggard</etym>, <sense id="n26254.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesennius Lento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 6, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 9, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lentor: <entryFree id="n26255" type="main" key="lentor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lentor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>lentus</etym>, <sense id="n26255.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pliancy, flexibility; toughness, stickiness, viscosity</hi> (Plinian; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">lentitia): ad rotarum axes lentore fraxinus utilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 43, 84, § 229</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lentor resinosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 6, 12, § 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">picis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 11</bibl></cit>, <cb n="LENT" /> 22, § <cit><quote lang="la">53: usque ad lentorem aliquid subigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 14, 24, § 111</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lentulitas: <entryFree id="n26256" type="main" key="Lentu^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lentŭlĭtas</orth>, v. 2. Lentulus.</entryFree>
