lentulus: <entryFree id="n26257" type="hapax" key="lentu^lus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lentŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n26257.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [lentus], <hi rend="ital">rather slow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lentulus aut restrictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 11, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26258" type="main" key="Lentu^lus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lentŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26258.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname of a distinguished family in the</hi> gens Cornelia. </sense><sense id="n26258.1" n="A" level="2"> Cn. Cornelius Lentulus Clodianus, <hi rend="ital">consul</hi> 682 A. U. C., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 8, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:39:section=95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 39, § 95</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26258.2" n="B" level="2"> Cn. Cornelius Lentulus Marcellinus, <hi rend="ital">consul</hi> 698 A. U. C., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:70:247" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 70, 247</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26258.3" n="C" level="2"> L. Cornelius Lentulus Crus, <hi rend="ital">consul</hi> 705 A. U. C., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:21:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 21, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:50" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 50</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26258.4" n="D" level="2"> P. Cornelius Lentulus Sura, <hi rend="ital">one of Catiline's fellow-conspirators</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:3 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 3 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 46</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26258.5" n="E" level="2"> P. Cornelius Lentulus Spinther, the elder, <hi rend="ital">a friend of Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:77:268" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 77, 268</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:95" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 95</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26258.6" n="F" level="1"> P. Cornelius Lentulus Spinther, <hi rend="ital">son of the preceding</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 26, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 11, 2</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n26258.7" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Len-tŭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the name</hi> or <hi rend="ital">nobility of a Lentulus</hi>, qs. <hi rend="ital">Lentulity</hi> (a comically formed word of Cicero): <cit><quote lang="la">Appietas (the nobility of an Appius) aut Lentulitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 7, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lentus: <entryFree id="n26259" type="main" key="lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cf. lenis</etym>, <sense id="n26259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pliant, flexible, tough, tenacious, sticky, viscous</hi> (syn.: flexilis, tardus, serus). </sense><sense id="n26259.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">viburna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genistae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rami,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 558</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbera,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>produced with the limber whip</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:634" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 634</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:171" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 171</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lentior salicis virgis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:800" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 800</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gluten visco et pice lentius,</quote> <trans><tr>tougher, more tenacious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita istaec nimis lenta vincla sunt escaria,</quote> <trans><tr>adhesive, tenacious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 1, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lentis adhaerens brachiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> Epod. 15, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam mas (aron) esset in coquendo lentior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 16, 92, § 143</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26259.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">slow, sluggish, immovable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus lenta gelu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 3, 39: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 26, 65, § 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in lento luctantur marmore tonsae,</quote> <trans><tr>sluggish, motionless</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lento pilo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:90" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 15, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uteri pondera lenta,</quote> <trans><tr>immovable, heavy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 96 (100): <cit><quote lang="la">herba durior et in coquendo lentior,</quote> <trans><tr>slower, longer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 16, 92, § 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remedia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:5:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 5, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:73" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">miserum populum Romanum, qui sub tam lentis maxillis erit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lentaque fori pugnamus harena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:47" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funus matris,</quote> <trans><tr>slow in coming</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:565" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 565</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26259.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26259.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Lasting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">continuing long</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">militiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:82" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 4, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tranquillitatis lentissimae taedium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 70" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lentus abesto,</quote> <trans><tr>remain long away</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 243</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivacitas adeo lenta,</quote> <trans><tr>persistent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 27, 41, § 100</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26259.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Slow, lingering, lazy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lentus in dicendo,</quote> <trans><tr>drawling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortis genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:87" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si lentus pigrā muniret castra dolabra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:248" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 248</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ira deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 100</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26259.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lentus coepti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:176" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 176</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26259.7" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec Idalia lenta incaluisse sagitta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:19" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26259.8" n="2" level="3"> Of bad payers, <hi rend="ital">slow, backward</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infitiatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotium,</quote> <trans><tr>tedious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 13</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n26259.9" n="C" level="2"> Of character, <hi rend="ital">easy, calm, indifferent, unconcerned, phlegmatic, sluggish, obstinate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut multa verba feci, ut lenta materies fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus ridiculi patientis ac lenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimium patiens et lentus existimor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hannibalem lenti spectamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lentus in suo dolore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu, Tityre, lentus in umbra,</quote> <trans><tr>at ease</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: lentissima pectora, <hi rend="ital">insensible, cold</hi> (to love), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 169</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n26259.10" n="D" level="2"> (Pliant, hence) <hi rend="ital">Ready, willing</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 22, 32</bibl>, and 338, 13.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lentē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">slowly, without haste, leisurely</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26259.11" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lente ac paulatim proceditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">currere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:13:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 13, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora lente augescunt, cito exstinguuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nilus evagari incipit, lente primo, deinde vehementius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 18, 47, § 167</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse cum reliquis copiis lentius subsequitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 40</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">asinus lentissime mandit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 15</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n26259.12" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">pliantly, readily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arida ligna lentius serrae cedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 43, 83, § 227</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n26259.13" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26259.14" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Calmly, dispassionately, indifferently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid lente ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:45:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 45, 190</bibl></cit>; cf. id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 338, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 10</bibl></cit>: respondere, <hi rend="ital">to answer</hi> <pb n="1051" /> <cb n="LEON" /> <hi rend="ital">cooly, phlegmatically</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:71:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 71, 287</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed haec videri possunt odiosiora, cum lentius disputantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:2:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 1, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid lentius, celerius dicendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 8, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26259.15" n="b" level="4"> In a good sense, <hi rend="ital">calmly, considerately, attentively</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi eum (librum) lente ac fastidiose probavissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lenullus: <entryFree id="n26260" type="main" key="le_nullus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēnullus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>2. leno</etym>, <sense id="n26260.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little pimp</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 2, 1, 25</bibl> (ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 614</bibl> P., lenulus).</sense></entryFree>
lenuncularius: <entryFree id="n26261" type="gloss" key="le_nuncu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēnuncŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>2. lenunculus, for lembunculus</etym>, <sense id="n26261.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who sails in a small vessel</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3248</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4054</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4104</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lenunculus: <entryFree id="n26262" type="main" key="le_nuncu^lus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēnuncŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>2. leno</etym>, <sense id="n26262.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a young go-between</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aere militari tetigero lenunculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 614</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26263" type="main" key="le_nuncu^lus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lēnuncŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>for lembunculus, from lembus</etym>, <sense id="n26263.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small sailingvessel, a bark, skiff</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauci lenunculi conveniebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 43</bibl></cit>: in lenunculo piscantes, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 534, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">occursu lenunculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscatorius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 2, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
leo: <entryFree id="n26264" type="gloss" key="le^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕo</orth>, <itype>lēre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> The root of deleo; cf. Prisc. l. 9 <sense id="n26264.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26265" type="main" key="le^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">le/wn, li/s</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n26265.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lion</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26265.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">validus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:985" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 985</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulvus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 10, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:373" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 373</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnanimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:5:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 5, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leoni praecipua generositas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 16, 17, § 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gaetulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:351" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 351</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Poenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 5, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phrygius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 10, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulvus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leonum animi index cauda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 16, 17, § 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leo alumnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:247" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pardus, tigris, leo— si quid adhuc est quod fremat in terris violentius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 36</bibl></cit>: leo femina, <hi rend="ital">a she-lion, lioness</hi> (for leaena), Plaut. Fragm. ap. Philarg. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 63</bibl>.—Without femina: <cit><quote lang="la">orbati leones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:1:9" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 1, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:317" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 317</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26265.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26265.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A lion's skin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:126" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 126</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26265.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The constellation</hi> Leo: <cit><quote lang="la">momenta Leonis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sol in Leone est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 17, 102, § 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pectore Leonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 26, 64, § 235</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26265.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of crab</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 31, 51, § 97</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26265.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A plant</hi>, perhaps <hi rend="ital">lion's-foot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:260" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 260</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:98" default="NO">98</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26265.7" n="E" level="2"> To denote a courageous person: <cit><quote lang="la">in pace leones, in proelio cervi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Coron. Mil. 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in praetoriis leones, in castris lepores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 7 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domi leones, foris vulpes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 44, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26266" type="main" key="Le^o3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĕo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>; only <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĕōnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <sense id="n26266.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the priests of the Persian god Mithras</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Leones Mithrae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
leocorion: <entryFree id="n26267" type="main" key="Le^o_co^ri^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĕōcŏrĭon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lewko/rion</foreign>, <sense id="n26267.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a temple in Athens</hi>, reared in honor of the three daughters of Leos, who suffered themselves to be sacrificed in order to avert a famine: <cit><quote lang="la">Leoidum est delubrum Athenis, quod Leocorion nominatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:19:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 19, 50</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
leocrocota: <entryFree id="n26268" type="main" key="leocro^co^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">leocrŏcŏta</orth>, v. leucrocota.</entryFree>
leoides: <entryFree id="n26269" type="main" key="Le^o_i^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĕōĭdes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n26269.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the daughters of Leos</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D 3, 19, 50</bibl> Wyttenb. (Lambin., Leo natarum; B. and K., Leocorion, q. v.).</sense></entryFree>
leon: <entryFree id="n26270" type="main" key="Le^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĕon</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*le/wn</foreign>. <sense id="n26270.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a town near Syracuse</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Magnisi; acc.</hi> Leonta, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:39:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 39, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26270.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A ruler of Phlius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:3:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 3, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26270.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A celebrated painter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 141</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leonidas: <entryFree id="n26271" type="main" key="Le^o_ni^das"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĕōnĭdas</orth> (<case>nom.</case> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĕōnĭda</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:11:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 11, 2</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lewni/das</foreign>. <sense id="n26271.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of Sparta, who fell at Thermopylæ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:30:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 30, 97</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 19, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:42:101" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 42, 101</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 49, 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26271.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a slave</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:43 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 43 al.</bibl>; v. also Leonides.</sense></entryFree>
leonides: <entryFree id="n26272" type="main" key="Le^o_ni^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĕōnĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n26272.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An instructor of Alexander the Great</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 14, 32, § 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26272.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A teacher of the younger Cicero at Athens</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 16, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 16</bibl>, A; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 21, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leoninus: <entryFree id="n26273" type="main" key="le^o_ni_nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕōnīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. leo</etym>, <sense id="n26273.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a lion, a lion's</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26273.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">concede audacter ab leonino cavo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">species,</quote> <trans><tr>a lion-like appearance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 54, § 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jubae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adeps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 17, 102, § 165</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n26273.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: leonina societas, <hi rend="ital">a lion's partnership</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in which one party gets all the profit and the other all the loss</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aristo refert: Cassium respondisse, societatem talem coiri non posse, ut alter lucrum tantum, alter damnum sentiret, et hanc societatem leoninam solitum appellare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:2:29:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 2, 29, § 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26274" type="main" key="Le^o_ni_nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĕōnīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n26274.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging<cb n="LEPI" />  to the emperor Leo, Leonine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 3, 50</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
leonnatus: <entryFree id="n26275" type="main" key="Leonna_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Leonnātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26275.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of Alexander's generals</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 26, § 97</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leonteus: <entryFree id="n26276" type="main" key="Le^onte^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĕontĕus</orth>, <itype>ĕi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26276.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a warrior</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:133" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 133</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leontice: <entryFree id="n26277" type="greek" key="le^onti^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕontĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">leontikh/</foreign>, <sense id="n26277.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, called also</hi> cacalia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 11, 85, § 135</bibl>; v. cacalia.‡ † <orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕontĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">leontiko/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a lion</hi>: SACRA, <hi rend="ital">the offerings made to Mithras, who was represented under the form of a lion</hi> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 196</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also 3. Leo),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2345</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2343</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leontini: <entryFree id="n26278" type="main" key="Le^onti_ni" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĕontīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*leonti=noi</foreign>, <sense id="n26278.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very ancient town on the eastern side of Sicily</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Lentini</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:16" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:66:section=160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 66, § 160</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 7, 2</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n26278.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĕontīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Leontini, Leontine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:44:section=104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 44, § 104</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:17:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 17, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:33:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 33, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">campus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:18:section=47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 18, § 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:8:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 8, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:126" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 126</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĕontīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Leontini, Leontines</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:46:section=109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 46, § 109</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leontios: <entryFree id="n26279" type="greek" key="le^onti^os"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕontĭos</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">leo/ntios</foreign>, <sense id="n26279.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone of the color of a lion</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 73, § 190</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leontium: <entryFree id="n26280" type="main" key="Le^onti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĕontĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*leo/ntion</foreign>, <sense id="n26280.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Athenian hetæra, a friend of Epicurus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:33:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 33, 93</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leontocaron: <entryFree id="n26281" type="greek" key="le^onto^ca^ron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕontŏcăron</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">leonto/karon</foreign>, <sense id="n26281.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leontopetalon: <entryFree id="n26282" type="greek" key="le^onto^pe^ta^lon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕontŏpĕtălon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">leontope/talon</foreign>, <sense id="n26282.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, lion's-leaf</hi>: Leontice leontopetalum, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 11, 72, § 96</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leontophonos: <entryFree id="n26283" type="greek" key="le^onto^pho^nos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕontŏphŏnos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">leontofo/nos</foreign> (lion-killer), <sense id="n26283.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small animal whose urine was said to be fatal to lions</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 38, 57, § 136</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leontopodion: <entryFree id="n26284" type="greek" key="le^onto^po^di^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕontŏpŏdĭon</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">leontopo/dion</foreign>, i. q. leontopetalon, <sense id="n26284.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, lion's-foot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 34, § 52</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leopardinus: <entryFree id="n26285" type="main" key="le^o^pardi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕŏpardīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>leopardus</etym>, <sense id="n26285.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of a leopard</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adeps,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
leopardus: <entryFree id="n26286" type="greek" key="le^o^pardus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕŏpardus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">leo/pardos</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n26286.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leopard</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">leopardi Libyci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Prob. 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leotychides: <entryFree id="n26287" type="main" key="Le^o_ty^chi^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĕōtychĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lewtuxi/dhs</foreign>, <sense id="n26287.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">brother of Agesilāus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lepareses: <entryFree id="n26288" type="gloss" key="Le^pa^re_ses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĕpărēses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, v. Lipara, II. B.</entryFree>
lepas: <entryFree id="n26289" type="greek" key="le^pas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕpas</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏpas</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 551, 5</bibl>), <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lepa/s</foreign>, <sense id="n26289.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of shell-fish that adheres closely to rocks, a limpet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lopades genus conchae marinae, Non. l. l.: lepadas (lopadas, acc. to Non.), ostreas, captamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lepasta: <entryFree id="n26290" type="main" key="le^pasta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕpasta</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕpesta</orth>, v. lepista.</entryFree>
lepidanus: <entryFree id="n26291" type="main" key="Le^pi^da_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĕpĭdānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. 2. Lepidus.</entryFree>
lepide: <entryFree id="n26292" type="main" key="le^pi^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕpĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. lepidus <sense id="n26292.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
lepidianus: <entryFree id="n26293" type="main" key="Le^pi^di^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĕpĭdĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. 2. Lepidus.</entryFree>
lepidium: <entryFree id="n26294" type="greek" key="le^pi^di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕpĭdĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lepi/dion</foreign>, <sense id="n26294.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, garden-cress, pepperwort</hi>: Lepidium sativum, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 51, § 166</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:41" default="NO">41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:8:3" default="NO">12, 8, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lepidotis: <entryFree id="n26295" type="greek" key="le^pi^do_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕpĭdōtis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">lepidwto/s</foreign>, scaly</etym>, <sense id="n26295.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 62, § 171</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lepidulus: <entryFree id="n26296" type="main" key="le^pi^du^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕpĭdŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n26296.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [1. lepidus], <hi rend="ital">rather pleasant, rather witty</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">infacetus et impar lepidulis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 726</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, § 807</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lepidus: <entryFree id="n26297" type="main" key="le^pi^dus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕpĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lepos</etym>, <sense id="n26297.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pleasant, agreeable, charming, fine, elegant, neat</hi> (esp. freq. in Plaut. and Ter.; in Cic. very rare). </sense><sense id="n26297.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">fui ego bellus, lepidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nugator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 5, 1, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o lepidum patrem!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 4, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego usa sum benigno et lepido et comi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 5, 3, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lepida es,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forma lepida et liberalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinus lepidum et festivum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itan' lepidum tibi visum est, scelus nos irridere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 7, 17</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos invenies alterum Lepidiorem ad omnes res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 65</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pater lepidissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 7, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o capitulum lepidissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 3, 3, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26297.2" n="B" level="2"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">nice, effeminate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi pueri tam lepidi ac delicati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 10, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26297.3" n="II" level="1"> In partic., of speech, <hi rend="ital">smart</hi>, <cb n="LEPO" /> <hi rend="ital">witty, facetious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lepida et concinna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 23, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scimus inurbanum lepido seponere dicto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 273</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 6, 17</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕpĭdē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">pleasantly, agreeably, charmingly, finely, prettily</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26297.4" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">lepide ornata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stratus lectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc effectum lepide tibi tradam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lepide ludificatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intellexisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:3:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 3, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lepide prospereque evenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi lepide voles esse tibi, mea rosa, mihi dicito,</quote> <trans><tr>when you want to enjoy yourself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 50</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26297.5" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n26297.6" n="(a)" level="5"> As an affirmative response, <hi rend="ital">yes, very well</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lepide licet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26297.7" n="(b)" level="5"> As a term of applause, <hi rend="ital">splendidly, excellently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">euge, euge, lepide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facete, laute, lepide: nihil supra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 37</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis lepide fabulare: eo potuerit lepidius pol fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:5:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 5, 52</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lepidissime et comissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 66</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26297.8" n="(g)" level="5"> Of speech, <hi rend="ital">smartly, wittily, humorously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo lepide in soceri mei persona lusit is, qui elegantissime id facere potuit, Lucilius: Quam lepide lexeis compostae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:43:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 43, 171</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:44:149" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 44, 149</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in libris multa posuit lepide atque argute reperta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:10:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 10, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26298" type="main" key="Le^pi^dus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĕpĭdus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26298.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname in the</hi> gens Aemilia; e. g. M. Aemilius Lepidus, <hi rend="ital">consul</hi> 675 A. U. C., <hi rend="ital">an enemy of Sylla</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 10, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:91:section=212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 91, § 212</bibl>.—Another M. Aemilius Lepidus, <hi rend="ital">triumvir with Antony and Octavius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 5, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:14:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 14, 39</bibl>; v. his letters to Cicero ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:34 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 34 sq.</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n26298.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĕpĭdā-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Lepidus, Lepidan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 3, 63</bibl></cit> Dietsch.—</sense><sense id="n26298.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lĕpĭdĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Lepidus, Lepidian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumultus,</quote> <trans><tr>which broke out a year after Sylla's death, in the consulate of M. Æmilius Lepidus</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lepis: <entryFree id="n26299" type="greek" key="le^pis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕpis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lepi/s</foreign>, <sense id="n26299.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a scale</hi> (pure Lat. squama): <cit><quote lang="la">similiter squamae aeris, quam vocant lepida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 11, 24, § 107</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lepista: <entryFree id="n26300" type="greek" key="le^pista"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕpista</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕpesta</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕpasta</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lepasth/</foreign>, <sense id="n26300.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drinking - vessel, goblet</hi>: lepista genus vasis aquarii, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=115" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 115</bibl> Müll.: lepistae aut fictiles aut aëneae, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 547, 26</bibl>: ferunt pulchras crateras aureasque lepistas, Naev. ap. Mar. Vict. p. 2587 P.—Form lepesta, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 714</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=123" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 123</bibl> Müll.—Form lepasta, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 547, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. E. 7, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lepontii: <entryFree id="n26301" type="main" key="Le_ponti^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lēpontĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lhpo/ntioi</foreign>, <sense id="n26301.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Cisalpine Gaul, on the Ticinus;</hi> their territory is the modern <hi rend="ital">Val Leventina</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 20, 24, § 134</bibl>; cf. Mann. Ital. 1, p. 181 sq.—Hence, * </sense><sense id="n26301.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lēpontĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Lepontian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:235" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 235</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lepor: <entryFree id="n26302" type="main" key="le^por"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕpor</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕpos</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>perh. root lamp-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">la/mpw, lampro/s</foreign>; cf. Lat. limpidus, lanterna</etym>, <sense id="n26302.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pleasantness, agreeableness, attractiveness, charm</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26302.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi salsa muriatica esse autumantur sine omni lepore et sine suavitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurea, pavonum ridenti imbuta lepore Saecla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:502" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 502</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1133" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 1133</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis vitae lepos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 7, 41, § 88</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26302.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n26302.3" n="A" level="2"> Of behavior, <hi rend="ital">pleasantness, grace, politeness, amiability</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">affluens omni lepore ac venustate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:54:section=142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 54, § 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo mihi videtur specimen fuisse humanitatis, salis, suavitatis, leporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:19:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 19, 55</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n26302.4" n="B" level="2"> As a term of endearment, = blanditiae, <hi rend="ital">my delight, charmer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">respice, o mi lepos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 4</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n26302.5" n="C" level="2"> Of speech, <hi rend="ital">pleasantry, wit, humor</hi> (so most freq. in Cic.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sal, facetiae, festivitas): Inest lepos ludusque in hac comoedia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:prol. 13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. prol. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea esset in homine jucunditas et tantus in jocando lepos ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 7, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbanitatis oratorius, non scurrilis, lepos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:38:143" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 38, 143</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:34:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 34, 159</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">floruit admirabili quodam lepore dicendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inusitatus nostris oratoribus lepos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:23:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 23, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes verborum, omnes sententiarum lepores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:27:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 27, 96</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
leporarius: <entryFree id="n26303" type="main" key="le^po^ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕpŏrārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lepus</etym>, <sense id="n26303.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a hare, hare-</hi>: lageos (vitis) est, quae Latine leporaria dicitur: nam <foreign lang="greek">lagw\s</foreign> lepus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 2, 93</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕpŏ-rārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a place where hares and</hi> <pb n="1052" /> <cb n="LEPU" /> <hi rend="ital">other wild animals are kept; a preserve, warren, cover</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3:12" default="NO">3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:20:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 20, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leporinus: <entryFree id="n26304" type="main" key="le^po^ri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕpŏrīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lepus</etym>, <sense id="n26304.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of a hare, hare-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coagulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:11:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 11, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 11, 46, § 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:70:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 70, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lepos: <entryFree id="n26305" type="main" key="le^pos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕpos</orth>, v. lepor.</entryFree>
lepra: <entryFree id="n26306" type="main" key="le_^pra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lē^pra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">le/pra</foreign>, <sense id="n26306.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the leprosy</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26306.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">plaga leprae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:13:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 13, 9 al.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 250" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 250</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26306.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">leprae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">lepras sedare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 8, 33, § 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 21, 86, § 234</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emendare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 25, 74, § 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 9, 31, § 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tollere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 17, 70, § 181</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lepreum: <entryFree id="n26307" type="main" key="Lepre^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Leprĕum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Leprĕon</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Leprĭon</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Leprĭum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Leprĕos</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*le/preon</foreign>, <sense id="n26307.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sea-coast town in Elis, south of Pylos;</hi> its ruins are near the modern town <hi rend="ital">Strobitza</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 5, 6, § 14</bibl>; cf. Mann. Griechenland, p. 525 sq.</sense></entryFree>
leprosus: <entryFree id="n26308" type="main" key="le^pro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕprōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lepra</etym>, <sense id="n26308.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">leprous</hi> (late Lat.). </sense><sense id="n26308.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">viri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 4, 191</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n26308.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: nil tam leprosum aut putridum, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 2, 285.</sense></entryFree>
lepta: <entryFree id="n26309" type="main" key="Lepta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lepta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">lepto/s</foreign>, weak</etym>, <sense id="n26309.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Q. Lepta, praefectus fabrūm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 7, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 20, 4</bibl>. To him are addressed the letters, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 18</bibl> and 19.</sense></entryFree>
leptis: <entryFree id="n26310" type="main" key="Leptis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Leptis</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<case>abl.</case> Lepte, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 27, 2, § 1</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*le/ptis</foreign>, <sense id="n26310.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of two cities on the coast of Africa</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26310.1" n="I" level="1"> Leptis Magna, <hi rend="ital">situated on the Great Syrtis</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Lebdah</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:7:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 7, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 4, 3, § 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 19, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:77:1" default="NO" valid="yes">77, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:15:8:section=11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 15, 8, § 11</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n26310.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lep-tĭmagnensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Leptis Magna</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 27, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26310.3" n="II" level="1"> Leptis Minor, <hi rend="ital">near Hadrumetum, the birthplace of the emperor Septimius Severus</hi>, near the modern <hi rend="ital">Lamta</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:7:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 19, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:59:section=155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 59, § 155</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:62" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 62</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Leptĭtānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Leptis, Leptitan.—Absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Leptĭtāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Leptis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:79" default="NO" valid="yes">79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leptomeres: <entryFree id="n26311" type="greek" key="lepto^me^res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">leptŏmĕres</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">leptomere/s</foreign>, <sense id="n26311.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consisting of fine particles</hi>, Theod. Prisc. de Diaeta, 10.</sense></entryFree>
leptomericus: <entryFree id="n26312" type="greek" key="lepto^me^ri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">leptŏmĕrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">leptomeriko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n26312.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consisting of fine particles</hi>: virtus, Theod. Prisc. de Diaeta, 10.</sense></entryFree>
leptoncentaurium: <entryFree id="n26313" type="greek" key="lepton centauri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lepton centaurĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-ĭon</orth>), <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lepto\n kentau/rion</foreign>, <sense id="n26313.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the lesser centaury</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">centaureum minus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 6, 31, § 68</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
leptophyllon: <entryFree id="n26314" type="greek" key="lepto^phyllon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">leptŏphyllon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lepto/fullon</foreign>, <sense id="n26314.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of the herb</hi> tithymalus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 45, § 71</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leptopsephos: <entryFree id="n26315" type="greek" key="leptopse_phos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">leptopsēphos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lepto/yhfos</foreign>, <sense id="n26315.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of porphyry with white spots</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 7, 11, § 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leptorax: <entryFree id="n26316" type="greek" key="lepto^rax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">leptŏrax</orth>, <itype>ăgis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lepto/rac</foreign>, <sense id="n26316.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of grape-vine with very small berries</hi> (like our Levant currants), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leptynticus: <entryFree id="n26317" type="greek" key="leptynti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">leptyntĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">leptuntiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n26317.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">making thin</hi> or <hi rend="ital">meagre</hi>: caeparum virtus leptyntica, Theod. Prisc. de Diaeta, 10.</sense></entryFree>
lepus: <entryFree id="n26318" type="main" key="le^pus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕpus</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<gen>com.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:12" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 55, 81, § 217</bibl>; <sense id="n26318.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>) [cf. Aeol. and Sicil. <foreign lang="greek">le/poris</foreign>, collat. form of <foreign lang="greek">lagw/s</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=101" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 101</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 3, 12</bibl>; but Curt. compares lepor, lepidus, root in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">la/mpw</foreign>], <hi rend="ital">a hare</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:12" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 55, 81, § 217</bibl>: lepus multum somni affert, qui illum edit, Cato ap. Diomed. p. 358 P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auritosque sequi lepores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:308" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 308</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:35" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 37, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare semesum leporem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:167" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 167</bibl></cit>.—Of the <hi rend="ital">she-hare</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lepus cum praegnans sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:12" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 55, 81, § 219</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fecundae leporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 44</bibl></cit> (fecundi, Keller).—Prov.: aliis leporem exagitare, <hi rend="ital">to hunt the hare for others</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to do something of which others reap the advantage</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 131</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:661" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 661</bibl>: lepus tute es et pulpamentum quaeris? <hi rend="ital">What! you a hare, and hunting for game?</hi> —In mal. part., Liv. Andron. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 36</bibl>; cf. Don. ad h. l. and <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Num. 13</bibl>. —As a term of endearment: <cit><quote lang="la">mens pullus passer, mea columba, mi lepus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 1, 50</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26318.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26318.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A poisonous seafish, of the color of a hare</hi>, the Aplysia depilans, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 48, 72, § 155</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 1</bibl>, <cb n="LETA" /> 3, § 8.—</sense><sense id="n26318.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The constellation</hi> Lepus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=365" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 365</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:44:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 44, 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 3:22" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 3, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 159</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lepusculus: <entryFree id="n26319" type="main" key="le^puscu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lĕpuscŭlus</orth> (contr. <sense id="n26319.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">acc. plur.</hi> lepusclos, Poët. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 38</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>lepus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a young</hi> or <hi rend="ital">little hare, leveret, a hare</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26319.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in qua (insula) lepusculos vulpeculasque saepe vidisses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:31:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 31, 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n26319.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:21:section=47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 21, § 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
leria: <entryFree id="n26320" type="gloss" key="leri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lerĭa</orth>, <itype>ornamenta tunicarum aurea</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=115" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 115</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
lerna: <entryFree id="n26321" type="main" key="Lerna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lerna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lernē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*le/rnh</foreign>, <sense id="n26321.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a forest and marsh near Argos, through which flowed a stream of the same name; the abode of the Lernæan Hydra, which Hercules slew with the help of Iolāus, and then drained the marsh</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">belua Lernae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 287</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anguifera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:181" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fecunda veneno,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Theb. 9, 340</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec dextra Lernam Placavit, Cic. poët. Tusc. 2, 9, 22: et Lerne pulsa tridente palus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:26:48" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 26, 48</bibl></cit> (3, 22, 20), where Müll. Lernae: Lerne, <hi rend="ital">also a town situated there</hi>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 9</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n26321.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lernaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Lernæan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:300" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 300</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hydra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:19:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 19, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mixtus Lernaei labe veneni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagittae,</quote> <trans><tr>with which Hercules killed the Hydra</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:392" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 392</bibl></cit>: cancer, <hi rend="ital">killed by Hercules at the same time with the Hydra</hi>, Col. poët. 10, 313. —</sense><sense id="n26321.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., <hi rend="ital">Argive, Grecian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lernaei reges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:499" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 499</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alumni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 638</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coloni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 461</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lesbia: <entryFree id="n26322" type="main" key="Lesbi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lesbĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n26322.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a woman</hi>, one of the dramatis personae in Ter. And.</sense></entryFree>
lesbos: <entryFree id="n26323" type="main" key="Lesbos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lesbos</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>), <itype>i</itype> (<case>acc.</case> Lesbum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 54</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*le/sbos</foreign>, <sense id="n26323.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated island in the Ægean Sea, off the coast of Troy and Mysia, the birthplace of Pittacus, Alcæus, Arion, Sappho, and Theophrastus, and famous for its wine;</hi> now <hi rend="ital">Mityleni</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed quam capiam civitatem cogito ... Lesbumne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 39, § 139</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nota,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n26323.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lesbĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Lesbian</hi>: Lesbiaci libri, <hi rend="ital">a work of Dicæarchus on the immortality of the soul</hi> (so called because the dialogues contained in it were held at Mitylene, in Lesbos), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:31:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 31, 77</bibl>: metrum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the Sapphic metre</hi> (because Sappho was a native of Lesbos), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 13</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in carm.</hi> 1. —</sense><sense id="n26323.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lesbĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*le/sbios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Lesbian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">civis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Alcæus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:32:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 32, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plectrum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Alcaic</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 26, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a lyric poem</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 6, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lesbia vates,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Sappho</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:7:20" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 7, 9, § 73</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:14:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 14, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:34" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 9, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">marmor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 6, 5, § 44</bibl></cit>.—Also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lesbĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Lesbian wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:17:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 17, 21</bibl>: Lesbium genus vasis caelati a Lesbis inventum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=115" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 115</bibl> Müll.—* </sense><sense id="n26323.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lesbōus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Lesbian</hi>: nec Polyhymnia Lesboum refugit tendere barbiton, <hi rend="ital">the Lesbian lyre</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">lyric songs</hi> (like those of Alcæus and Sappho), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 34</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26323.4" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lesbĭ-as</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lesbia/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a Lesbian woman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lesbiadum turba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lesbias,</quote> <trans><tr>a precious stone found in Lesbos</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 62, § 171</bibl></cit> (al. Lesbia).—</sense><sense id="n26323.5" n="E" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lesbis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lesbi/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Lesbian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lesbida cum domino seu tulit ille lyram,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Arion the Lesbian poet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:82" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lesbi puella, vale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 15, 100</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst., a Lesbian woman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lesbides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 199</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
